Coming to the realization that I am in fact a chick. \n\nI walked past the mirror this morning, no make up, hair all over the place in a tank top and shorts and honestly it surprised me how different I look. I went from being a185 pound dude, a beard and some muscles to being this little chick who’s 135 pounds, no facial hair, some boobs lol and much softer facial features. \n\n\"Holy Shit, I’m a chick\" I thought to myself. It’s highly rewarding knowing that I’ve come so far and been looked at as a freak or a faggot for the past two years.\n\nI’ve got a long way to go I know, but just being able to actually see the results my self now and not being constantly misgendered is one of the greatest feelings I’ve ever experienced. \n\nSo thanks to all my family and friends, Facebook friends, instagram and tumblr followers for helping to push me through this time in my life. You, the people who whine about this kind of bullshit and make themselves a victim. That includes the tumblr feminists, trans community, culture aproprists and the list goes on. For example I do think of myself as a feminist and have feminist views. Why I would never be a part of the tumblr feminists? Because blogging about hating men and making yourself the victim 24/7 isn’t feminism. It’s stupidity!\n\nAlso the trans community is not much better than the feminists. I really don’t care if you are trans, gender fluid, gender queer, but leave people who have nothing to do with your community alone. It really is hard to comprehend the fact that cis people who feel ok in their own skin are ridiculed and called cis scum while trans people are whining about how oppressive our existence alone is. I understand hating transphobic people and bigots, but this is just stupid. This is the reason why tumblr is a joke to the masses and why you, trans people are a joke to many. How can people take you people seriously when you yell about privileges that cis people have, but then act like you’re a special snowflake and higher than everybody else. I’m for equality for everybody, but being an ass won’t get you shit. \n\nTo sum it up the tumblr communities suck and are full of idiots, bigots and assholes, but of course in every community there [{"blog_name":"all-hail-the-prophet-chuck","id":97412379056,"post_url":"http://all-hail-the-prophet-chuck.tumblr.com/post/97412379056/i-had-a-wicked-awesome-idea","slug":"i-had-a-wicked-awesome-idea","type":"text","date":"2014-09-13 20:54:25 GMT","timestamp":1410641665,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"KgWzJqpN","tags":["transgender","idea","clothing","non-profit","trans","original post"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZjIZBv1QkEl6m","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":29,"title":"I Had A Wicked Awesome Idea","body":"So, I’m a recently out transguy, and I’m giving away/selling my used women’s clothing. My good friend is male, but likes dressing in women’s clothing. So I am giving him some of the stuff an in return he said he’d give me some sort of donation (he didn’t indicate yet). And it got me thinking…\n\nThere should be a non-profit organisation of some sort where trans/genderfluid/genderqueer/etc people can swap their old clothes for new clothes that go better with their identity and preferences with other trans/genderfluid/genderqueer people.\n\nCan we please make this happen??","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"fuckmylife333","id":97412110710,"post_url":"http://fuckmylife333.tumblr.com/post/97412110710/had-another-laser-session-on-my-neck-the-place-i","slug":"had-another-laser-session-on-my-neck-the-place-i","type":"text","date":"2014-09-13 20:50:56 GMT","timestamp":1410641456,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"zROj7qw2","tags":["mtf","ftm","trans","transgender","lgbt","lgbtq","queer","genderqueer"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/Zh7qZn1QkDjbs","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":4,"title":"","body":"Had another laser session on my neck. The place I go to said they’ll do my whole face for $200 for 6 sessions. WOW. I’m pretty sure that’s going to happen.\n\nLately I fee absolutely terrible when I go to work for the few days I’m in the office and tone things down. No makeup, usually allow some stubble to grow. The last work day of the week, I come home, shave, do my nails, put on some leggings and an undershirt, and I feel like me again.\n\nToned down guy mode (opposed to playing up femininity) is feeling less and less right or doable. I’m thinking about coming out to my family as queer since they think I’m totally cis and heterosexual. At least that could be a starting point for gender bending and opening up about sexuality.\n\nThen if I came out as trans in a year, it wouldn’t be completely out of nowhere.\n\nHow did other people come out to their families? boxers under a skirt","body":"I am in the non-binary spectrum and am absolutely revolted about how many people are afraid of being who they are. I have had a hard time finding who I am, I went through phases where I didn’t know how to label myself and it hurt like hell because I knew people where looking at me wondering the same thing. \n\nBeing 23 years old now, I expected to know which gender I was, what was my sexuality. But after a long talk with my mother, I found out it wasn’t important. She loves me any way. \n\nOf course, it doesn’t stop people from speaking ill of me or encouraging me to “make up my mind”. \n\nShould I change because people didn’t feel comfortable ? Hell no ! If I want to be a woman one day and a man the next day, neither or even both, I will ! If I feel like I want to have sex and then not want to for a year, it’s my god damned business ! If I like girls, boys, both or neither depending on my mood, it’s none of their concern !\n\nI am not ashamed of who I am, I am ashamed by some humans’ behavior. \n\nI don’t push my identity in anyone’s throat, I don’t claim being an alien in the streets. I live my life the way I want and I don’t disturb anyone’s life by doing so. Eliana Rubashkyn and I was born in Bogotá, Colombia. I’m a trained pharmacist and speak five languages fluently, and until recently, I was studying for an MBA in Health Administration in Taiwan on a government scholarship. I also used to be a man.\n\nLast year, I was forced to travel to Hong Kong to renew my passport because of my altered gender. […] Little did I know my life would be turned upside down when I boarded that plane. […]\n\nOn arrival at Hong Kong’s sprawling international airport, immigration officials reacted with a combination of confusion and hostility after looking at my travel documents. I arrived as a woman but my passport identified me as a man. […]\n\nI was detained in a cramped room at the airport and permitted access to the male toilet only, despite my repeated requests to be allowed to use the female facilities.\n\nA deportation letter was soon issued to me, which meant Hong Kong authorities were forcing me to leave. I feared I’d be sent back to Colombia, a place I had left because I suffered discrimination and violent abuse — including two murder attempts — precisely because I’m transgender. […]\n\nWhile the process to become a refugee can take years, the situation was so clear for the agency that full status was conferred in only 12 days. September 30 last year marked the day I became a “stateless person.” I had effectively surrendered my nationality.[…]\n\nThe struggle for many like me continues, but there is always hope. When it seems there is not a clear reason to continue fighting, my life still has a meaning — being myself, being Eliana.”\n\nRead the whole Everyone is nice and stuff and the teachers are hecka [these are teachers from my imaginary dream school and I’m sitting here thinking they somehow crawled out of my imagination and became a living being]. I really like being there but there’s also the thing where I don’t want to be shoved back into the closet. I’ve already said I was pansexual (panromantic but I am not going to deal with explaining that to everyone), and it was subtle but I didn’t hesitate. I kind got into a topic at lunch with new friends having to do with how everyone at the school was cute as fuck and I just sort of said “Yeah but you’re not pansexual.” and they were cool with it. But that’s not the part of the closet I’m worried about.\n\nI want people to know I’m a guy. Like everyone (excluding every teacher besides my spanish teacher, and my friend from before school started) uses feminine pronouns. I want to tell them I’m a guy but instead of just going, “Oh, I’m sorry, my mistake. So he [continues previous conversation].” they will most likely go along the lines of, “Oh, I thought you were a girl. Sorry. But are you like a boy-girl/girl-boy/t*****/ trans girl/one of those transgendered people [btw transgendered is not an appropriate way to address someone being trans*]? I just — It’s not that I give two shits about what they call me or think of me afterward, just as long as they know I’m a guy. I don’t care about the trans* part being in their head, I care about the being a guy part. I don’t know.\n\nSorry. I needed to get this out. [{"blog_name":"bakamitaii","id":97384772207,"post_url":"http://bakamitaii.tumblr.com/post/97384772207/140913-seto-kojis-blog","slug":"140913-seto-kojis-blog","type":"photo","date":"2014-09-13 14:40:12 GMT","timestamp":1410619212,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"7ApskkAy","tags":["seto koji","shirota yuu","setokojiblogtranslation","setokojitrans","trans"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/Z7Imlo1QibR9l","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":18,"source_url":"http://ameblo.jp/koji-seto-we/entry-11924415303.html?timestamp=1410605113","source_title":"ameblo.jp","caption":"140913 Seto Koji’s Blog 2\n\n<!-- more -->\n\nファントム\n\n城田優主演、ミュージカル『ファントム』を観に行った。\n\n甘く切ない“愛”が沢山詰まった作品。\n\nその愛を繊細に残酷に描いた作品だった。\n\n事務所の先輩が城田さん含め3人出演している。\n\n まずは主人公、エリックを演じる城田優さん。\n\n城田さんがD-BOYSだった頃から知っているが、どんな事をやるにもズバ抜けていて、到底敵わないという印象。\n\n今回のミュージカル『ファントム』でも、堂々とした立ち姿、歌唱力、芝居で凄まじいオーラを放っていた。\n\n主人公、エリックの繊細さ、可愛らしさがしっかり伝わってきた。\n\nいつも堂々としている城田さんだが、本人も本当は緊張しいで、1人で悩んでいたりとエリックみたいな性格の持ち主なのではないだろうか…\n\n瀬戸はそう分析しました。\n\nそしてオペラ座の支配人、ゲラール・キャリエールを演じる吉田栄作さん。\n\nん～、この作品を知らない人にはネタバレになりそうで書けないな～。\n\nとにかく僕は泣きました。\n\n男とはいえ人間は弱い生き物で、なかなか強くなれない。\n\nそんな切ない男を熱演されてます。\n\nあ～、言いたい！\n\n最後にオペラ座の新プリマドンナ、カルロッタを演じるマルシアさん。\n\n存在感が半端ではない。\n\n指先や体の動きも個性的で、舞台に出てくる度に目を奪われてしまう。\n\n歌唱力はもちろん、セリフや歌っている時の声色の切り替え、僕大好きです。\n\nまだまだ魅力たっぷりのミュージカル『ファントム』、皆さんも是非足を運んでみて下さい。\n\n出演者・スタッフの皆さん、素晴らしい作品をありがとうございました！\n\nミュージカル『ファントム』の公式HPはコチラ\n\nPhantom\n\nI went to see the musical “Phantom”, starring Shirota Yuu.\n\nIts a work that is packed with sweet and painful “love”.\n\nIts a work that draws out the cruelty of a delicate love.\n\nShirota-san, a senior in the office, and 2 others are in the film.\n\n Firstly the protagonist, Erik played by Shirota Yuu.\n\nAlthough I’ve known Shirota-san from D-BOYS, whatever he does he would excel in it, I have that impression of him where no matter what (he does) there is no match for him.\n\nIn this musical “Phantom” too, with a magnificent posture, singing ability, letting out a tremendous aura during the play.\nThe protagonist, Erik’s delicacy, has been expressed clearly in a cute way.\n\nEven though Shirota-san always look dignified, but he does get really nervous, being troubled by himself and I wonder if he has the personality like Erik…\n\nThat’s what Seto has realized. \n\n And the manager of the opera house, Gérard Carrière played by Yoshida Eisaku-san.\n\nHmm, I shall not write spoilers for people who do not know the story of this work~.\n\nAnyways I cried.\n\nAlthough man said that humans are weak creatures, and can’t get stronger.\n\nHe performed enthusiastically as a role of a sad man.\n\nAh~ I want to say (something)!\n\n At the end, the new prima donna of the opera house, Carlotta played by Marcia-san.\n\nHer presence is of no joke.\n\nThe movements of her fingertips and her body is distinctive, whenever she gets on stage, you would be captivated by her.\n\nOf course her singing skills (is good), the switching of tone between her singing and dialogue, I loved that.\n\nThere is still much more charm of the musical “Phantom”, everyone please come watch it by all means.\n\nTo the casts and staffs, thank you for the wonderful work!\n\nThe homepage for musical “Phantom” is here.\n\ntrans. cr; shin @ bakamitaii ; take out with full My weekend is turning out to be very busy, and we want to take nice photos in natural light and its been a bit rainy. Its sad that I can’t, but I love the rain.\n\nToday, after getting through the aches and umpfs of waking up, I felt so calm. It was wonderful. I felt like I had more clarity, as well, and that the day was going to be fantastic. And it was pretty fantastic, despite some wannabe arsonist tossing my water bottle into the fire pit at my favorite bar. I’m not even mad, just a bit aggravated that, with money so tight, I’m going to have to toss down fifteen bucks for a new one. But regardless, we got invited out by a generous friend and I had a wonderful time.\n\nMy big change for today, I guess may not be as coincidental as I thought. Apparently, vision changes can happen depending on how your body deals with HRT. I noticed first that signs far away from me were near illegible, despite having my corrective lenses in. That was a bit distressing, but not terribly so. On the other hand, I noticed that colors are amazingly, gorgeously vibrant! Even our bottle of detergent has a whole new ranges of tones to it, that I never saw before. So far, so good.\n\n~Cecil","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"totalfuckupp","id":97375047088,"post_url":"http://totalfuckupp.tumblr.com/post/97375047088/agh-i-was-put-with-my-family-and-i-needed-the","slug":"agh-i-was-put-with-my-family-and-i-needed-the","type":"text","date":"2014-09-13 11:31:20 GMT","timestamp":1410607880,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"xtfvaV30","tags":["rant","personal","trans","dysphoria","bathrooms","binding","midgendering","rib injuries","graduation"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZkoNYt1Qi0Ksm","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":1,"title":"","body":"Agh I was put with my family and I needed the toilet and my mum directed me to the women’s and I couldn’t be fucked arguing even though I went to the men’s toilet in the same complex on Tuesday with no issue. Like in the women’s I could see women looking at me in the mirror and also it makes me feel like shit to be in there. \n\nAnd also I’m worried I injured my ribs binding but I have to bind tomorrow for my grad and afters and then I won’t have to bind for a month but it’ll be hours and it’s quite painful. \n\nAnd I have permission to wear the guys uniform but the only one I have I borrowed from a friend who’s way taller than me. And it’s also the old uniform which is very similar to the current one but it’s not the same. \n\nBlergh I’m just frustrated.","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"bakamitaii","id":97373513902,"post_url":"http://bakamitaii.tumblr.com/post/97373513902/140913-seto-kojis","slug":"140913-seto-kojis","type":"photo","date":"2014-09-13 10:49:00 GMT","timestamp":1410605340,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"RWU86U2s","tags":["seto koji","setokojiblogtranslation","setokojitrans","trans","well he look good today"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/Z7Imlo1QhwUYk","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":6,"source_url":"http://ameblo.jp/koji-seto-we/entry-11924295811.html","source_title":"ameblo.jp","caption":"140913 Seto Koji’s Blog\n\n<!-- more -->\n\nふと思った\n\nブログなどのコメント読んでますか？\nよく聞かれる。\n\nもちろん読んでいる。\n\n僕は好きでブログなど書いているからいいのだが、皆さんは忙しい日々の中でわざわざ僕のブログなどに目を通し、コメントまで書いてくれる。\n\n本当に嬉しい。\n\nそして気分が上がる。\n\n頑張ろうと思える。\n\n前にも書いたかもしれないが、僕らの仕事は夢や勇気、元気などを与える職業だと思っていたし、おそらくそうだろう。\n\nしかし僕に関しては支えられ、元気を貰っている実感の方が強い。\n\n貰ったらお返しをする。\n\nそういう考え方からすると、先日一般発売されたD☆DATEのLIVE DVDは、お客さんの一般発売してほしいという想いを貰った僕ら側が、その気持ちに応えて発売するという形でお返しした。ということになるなと、ふと思った。\n\nお客さんの声はとても勉強になるし、それだけ僕らの事を想い、考えてくれているということが伝わる。\n\nその大切な声に応えられるよう、これからも頑張っていきたい。\n\n今日もカフェでそんな事を考えている瀬戸であった…\n\nI suddenly thought\n\nDo you read the comments on your blog etc?\nI’m often asked this.\n\nOf course I do read it.\n\nBecause I wish I could comment on blogs that I like, for everyone to specially read my blog even when you guys are busy, and also to comment on it.\n\nMakes me really happy.\n\nThis increases my mood.\n\nMaking me want to work harder.\n\nI might have wrote this before but, our job is through dream and courage, I think it is a profession that provides people with energy, it possibly might be something like this.\n\nHowever for those who have supported me, their energy and feelings I received are really strong. \n\nTo return this favour.\n\nFrom this way of thinking, D☆DATE’s LIVE DVD which was publicly released the other day, hearing that the public would want it to be generally released, in response to that feeling, it was returned in the form of it being generally released. So that was how it (became released), I suddenly though.\n\nWe can learn a lot from the audiences voices, while thinking about us, telling us where we should improve on.\n\nIn response to that important voice, I would want to work harder now and in the future.\n\n  \n\nThat was what Seto was thinking in the cafe today…\n\ntrans. cr; shin @ bakamitaii ; take out with credits","photoset_layout":"2","photos":[{"caption":"","alt_sizes":[{"width":480,"height":480,"url":"http://33.media.tumblr.com/7eae1cbc56c1e87b2141b4bd7432e0c7/tumblr_nbu61oaBcK1tpu779o1_500.jpg"},{"width":400,"height":400,"url":"http://31.media.tumblr.com/7eae1cbc56c1e87b2141b4bd7432e0c7/tumblr_nbu61oaBcK1tpu779o1_400.jpg"},{"width":250,"height":250,"url":"http://38.media.tumblr.com/7eae1cbc56c1e87b2141b4bd7432e0c7/tumblr_nbu61oaBcK1tpu779o1_250.jpg"},{"width":100,"height":100,"url":"http://33.media.tumblr.com/7eae1cbc56c1e87b2141b4bd7432e0c7/tumblr_nbu61oaBcK1tpu779o1_100.jpg"},{"width":75,"height":75,"url":"http://31.media.tumblr.com/7eae1cbc56c1e87b2141b4bd7432e0c7/tumblr_nbu61oaBcK1tpu779o1_75sq.jpg"}],"original_size":{"width":480,"height":480,"url":"http://33.media.tumblr.com/7eae1cbc56c1e87b2141b4bd7432e0c7/tumblr_nbu61oaBcK1tpu779o1_500.jpg"}},{"caption":"","alt_sizes":[{"width":480,"height":480,"url":"http://38.media.tumblr.com/419be4d84d26a24608e73299642ad54d/tumblr_nbu61oaBcK1tpu779o2_500.jpg"},{"width":400,"height":400,"url":"http://33.media.tumblr.com/419be4d84d26a24608e73299642ad54d/tumblr_nbu61oaBcK1tpu779o2_400.jpg"},{"width":250,"height":250,"url":"http://38.media.tumblr.com/419be4d84d26a24608e73299642ad54d/tumblr_nbu61oaBcK1tpu779o2_250.jpg"},{"width":100,"height":100,"url":"http://38.media.tumblr.com/419be4d84d26a24608e73299642ad54d/tumblr_nbu61oaBcK1tpu779o2_100.jpg"},{"width":75,"height":75,"url":"http://38.media.tumblr.com/419be4d84d26a24608e73299642ad54d/tumblr_nbu61oaBcK1tpu779o2_75sq.jpg"}],"original_size":{"width":480,"height":480,"url":"http://38.media.tumblr.com/419be4d84d26a24608e73299642ad54d/tumblr_nbu61oaBcK1tpu779o2_500.jpg"}}],"can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"sukaihan","id":97372999768,"post_url":"http://sukaihan.tumblr.com/post/97372999768/trans-a-translation-of-a-heartfelt-letter","slug":"trans-a-translation-of-a-heartfelt-letter","type":"text","date":"2014-09-13 10:34:21 GMT","timestamp":1410604461,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"xilPTIex","tags":["luhan","exo","trans"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZOleNu1QhuX1O","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":7,"title":"[Trans] \"努力加餐饭\": A translation of a heartfelt letter written by a cfan for Luhan","body":"This was originally written by a cfan, @NiobiumDeer on Weibo (http://m.weibo.cn/5041575610/3752885924328667?sourcetype=page&amp;lfid=1076035041575610_-_WEIBO_SECOND_PROFILE_WEIBO&amp;lcardid=1076035041575610_-_WEIBO_SECOND_PROFILE_WEIBO_-_3752885924328667&amp;luicode=10000198&amp;_status_id=3752885924328667&amp;featurecode=10000001&amp;uicode=10000002) and I spent about two hours translating what she wrote because I was really touched by and really agreed with what she said, and I want to share it with those who can’t read Mandarin, so please don’t claim the credits for something 1) you didn’t write and 2) you didn’t translate. Please credit properly.\n\n  Also…I tried translate as accurately as possible but I’m no professional and also, there’s just some things about another language that…the beauty in its words just can’t be translate across…With that said, please take a moment to appreciate, even if you’re not his fan/stan, the hard work Lu Han (and all other members in EXO and other idols) has put into getting where he stands today…and my heart really hurts for he who…has also suffered so much..in getting here…and staying here. I love you, deer of dawn.\n\n<!-- more -->\n\nI stayed with my uncle when I was young, and my cousin was only six years older than me. He was a very unruly kid, but he had an almost extreme dedication/passion for cars.\n\n  His family wanted him to study, get into college and become a doctor, and so they nagged at him everyday, but he could (only wanted to) study things related to cars/things about cars, and the area of car models in his room far exceeds the area occupied by his bed. When he was seventeen, he ran away from home and nobody knew where he went. When I was in high school, relatives from 安徽 (An Hui - a place in China) brought back the message that he was managing a car dealing company there and business was good. The family wanted my uncle to contact him (get in touch with him) but my uncle was equally stubborn and so he furiously rejected the idea.\n\n  The year I was done with high school, we heard (from people in An Hui) that my cousin got injured and broke his leg while on his way to discuss a contract. My uncle took a flight there in a rush, and he brought back my cousin, who was tanned, skinny and walking with a limp. Over a meal (a family meal), my cousin suddenly started crying, and his tears fell in the soup bowl.\n\n  My uncle wordlessly changed the bowl, and told him, “Eat, it’s getting cold.”\n\n  ———\n\n  It’s said that to be a good man, one has to dare to venture, and to be a real man one has to be able to get out there and shoulder (responsibilities), doing whatever possible (no matter how tough) to earn a living and support his family back home, and he would do anything to cover a gunshot wound on his shoulder with a shoulder of medals (this basically means earning glory and honour at the expense of injuries etc).\n\n  No matter how bruised and battered, but at the very least he had achievements and had done his parents proud. I always thought that was what growing up meant.\n\n  But that day I suddenly came to an understanding. The ones who love you don’t care for whether or not the place you are standing is full of glory and glamour, they care more about whether or not you have a bowl of steamy rice before you when you’re hungry, whether or not you have someone accompanying you when you’re sick, when you’re in pain, and when you’re struck down and at a loss of what to do.\n\n  ——-\n\n  I used to ask/expect a lot of/from you.\n\n  I wished for you to keep improving, to step up to the top of thus world, and I wished for you to seize every opportunity possible so the next day, you can become the eternally shining star everyone knows about. I once was like many others, getting angry because you couldn’t get the things we felt you deserved (because of your losses, basically), and it was hard for me to sleep and eat, and like a revolutionary soldier, I forwent sleep to send the same email all night.\n\n  Back then, a lot of those who have gotten in touch with you were already saying that there were issues with your health. But back then, I was blinded by the desire I had built upon you, and I fervently joined the almost ritualistic activities that I’ve been anticipating for a long time.\n\n  And just an hour before I read the news, I was thinking, once the concert is over, I must continue sending those emails, I must not let you be the only one left with nothing to do (no schedules). (We) Must let everything that can possibly happen happen to you (meaning to give the best possible arrangements etc to Luhan).\n\n  ——\n\n  The instant I saw the news, the picture, all the wishes that had been so loud and fervent inside me lost their voices. And all the details which had been overlooked resurfaced.\n\n  I remember, in February, during an interview, when you talked about going into the sea in the middle of winter, you used the words 千刀万剐 (like being sliced ten thousand times by a thousand knives).\n\n  I remember, in April, I saw with my own eyes, after your dance performance had ended, you were panting heavily, hidden in a corner where the light couldn’t reach.\n\n  I remember, back when the group was promoting Miracles In December, your eyes were bloodshot from fever, I remember you turning away from the microphone during the recording for Happy Camp to cough as softly as possible, I remember you massaging/hitting your thigh, in pain, when you were rehearsing for SMTOWN, and I remember how you deliberately tried to hide the tremble/instability in your walk back in Xi An (airport?).\n\n  ——\n\n  You left home at the age of eighteen to a foreign land for your studies, and behind you stood so many people who didn’t understand your decision, or perhaps wholly disapproved of your choices. I once imagined you, that month of that year, in a foreign place, having to wait - without anything you can expect to happen/without anything you can count on happening - even if you had clenched your teeth (a metaphor for waiting, enduring) until your whole mouth tasted of acid.\n\n  At the age of eighteen, most of us won’t have to struggle to feed and support the family, and the only faith we have to support us is to give this world a tight, loud slap with our own hands, to prove that our determination is not for a mere daydream, to prove that we can live a fruitful life as we are supported by our own youthful dreams.\n\n  And you did indeed live humbly, staying silent in spite of all the hardships you were going through. And most of us, at your age, no matter what, wouldn’t have dared to take such a gamble and held our breath through it all. That was the majority which you had set yourself apart from, and you fought on, all by yourself, and in the tough silence you finally made your way to the front of the crowd.\n\n  I really wish to know, that year, in your phone call home, if you were always like the “you” captured by all the lenses this year, always full of life and energy, as if by standing there, there would be an infallible wall (protecting you).\n\n  ——-\n\n  And then you debuted, and it appeared as though you valued (having to shoulder all those responsibilities), having all those labels stuck on you, and you had to be careful even when you speak. A single tree standing out amongst the forest faces the danger of being the first to fall/to be destroyed, and so one must fight the merciless wind and rain. And you stayed the same, just like the “you” when you first set sail.\n\n  That year, on stage, you held the microphone and said buwangchuxin (to never forget the heart you set sailed with/to never forget one’s original goals and purpose and attitude etc), and you were so sincere, I thought you were making/reading a vow. And then, just like you said, you carried yourself as if you would never tire.\n\n  Do you remember when you said when you first started playing the rubric cube, and you just couldn’t resist and had to hold it in your hands and practise? That moment, I guessed that you’re someone who always asked too much of himself, and as long as you’re learning something, you pay more attention than anyone on the details, even if you’re always practising. In the days following that, at the airports and in between recordings, you are always seen dancing the moves you’ve been dancing hundreds and thousands of times, just because you’re scared of making one mistake. \n\n  I really wanted to live my life the way you do, but I know there isn’t a second person who has developed the same unyielding power you have. They can be just like you, but they’re not /you/.\n\n  ——\n\n  The song that you participated in shot to fame and so, you got to stand on countless stages to receive all the awards. Only once did your eyes turn red. That year, at the end of the year, you looked into the camera and said what your new year resolution was. You said, you want to be someone outstanding.\n\n  Finally, I couldn’t bring myself to try feeling whatever it was that you’re feeling, I couldn’t possibly guess, as you were repeatedly practising all those dances and all those songs, just how vast is/was the sky that you’re aiming for.\n\n  I’ve seen for myself that you’re already standing at the peak where many others have to spend a great deal more time to reach, so why do I feel that your eyes are still filled with the anticipation and eagerness they contained when you first set sailed?\n\n  Finally, this year, the year I had predicted that would dim all the glow/shine. Your 本命年 (), as if it’s been cursed.\n\n  With your new identity and all the new awards you’ve earned, and with a life more splendid than the ones others have ever lived, and having received more love than before. I thought you would be able to withstand all that would come your way and you would gain more than you would lose.\n\n  Eventually, your eyes stopped smiling as much as they once did.\n\n  —-\n\n  You joined the cast for a movie, and you always responded shyly to being well liked by the seniors. Back then I’ve heard many stories about you on set, and you were someone who carefully studied everything, even a single move involving cycling.\n\n  And then there was that incident about sasaengs, and the essay we wrote about you “being used to it” were shared by tens of thousands. We penned down all the hardships and sorrow with every word we typed, but we dared not think, once more, just how much you, you who had experienced all those things firsthand, have suffered and endured.\n\n  It was then that we realised how scary your tolerance was, to have been able to laugh in spite of all the pressure life has thrown at you, even if it had been just for the sake of comforting those who care for you, those who are pained by your sufferings.\n\n  ——\n\n  For two whole years, you’ve always appeared as if you are infallible, and now, I finally understand the truth behind that infallible front of yours.\n\n  That tree I had thought would never fall, had exhausted all of his energy just to work hard in order to stand tall, stand upright.\n\n  And as opposed to wanting to see you conquer your quest of chasing the stars (in stardom), now, I would rather see you go home for a good meal.\n\n  I wish to see you step off that stage, and walk towards the lights that will guide you home.\n\n  There, they won’t care of you could wield the wind and rule the world, they would only care about whether or not you’re hungry.\n\n  There, they won’t even be able to stand to see you suffer from the smallest injuries at work, let alone see every part of you bogged down by said injuries.\n\n  ——\n\n  I once hoped that you, Luhan, would always belong to the stage, belong to us, but the stage, at the end, hasn’t returned us a healthy and happy “you”.\n\n  You said, you wish everyone is healthy, happy and together with their families.\n\n  But you’re always miles away from home, from your family, and you, in the midst of the applause given to you by healthy, happy fans, are the only one who can neither stay healthy nor happy.\n\n  Then go home and be united with your family, I suppose, that Luhan who belongs to his father and mother, should be able to give us a carefree and long-lived ” you”. \n\n  ——-\n\n  My dearest, you must be tired.\n\n  You really don’t have to keep striving to prove anything anymore. To us, to the ones who love you most, you’ve proven a great deal - you’ve proven far too much.\n\n  I know that in your heart, there is world at your evey beck and call, it’s vast, so vast that we can never see its limits. But you don’t have to rush to expand your territories and your domains, because you’re still young, and even if you pause to take a break, the world will still remain by your side.\n\n  And so please, do wait a while, rest a while, and work hard to eat an extra bowl of rice.","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"procryptic","id":97372940424,"post_url":"http://procryptic.tumblr.com/post/97372940424/im-cute","slug":"im-cute","type":"photo","date":"2014-09-13 10:32:42 10:15:45 GMT","timestamp":1410603345,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"QJPeIHeY","tags":["Anonymous","trans","transgender","transphobia","transmisogyny","misgendering","violence","frtasks","cissexism"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZHQdjr1Qhs63E","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":4,"asking_name":"Anonymous","asking_url":null,"question":"I am very uneducated on this subject but I was just wondering, if a boy that feels like a girl and dresses like a girl and whatnot attacks a non trans girl is that okay? Or what? I'm not being disrespectful or anything like that at all I was just wondering and the only way to get educated in this is to ask?","answer":"Okay first off I want you to read this Trans 101 primer because the way that you asked this question was misgendering & hurtful toward trans people. You say you’re just not educated & not trying to be disrespectful and I appreciate that, but please read the Trans 101 so that you can become more educated, because a trans woman isn’t a boy, and that’s a really bad thing to insinuate.\n\nSecondly, I’m not 100% sure what you’re asking. No one should really attack anyone, but I’m frankly more concerned with cis people attacking trans women than vice versa. So no, it’s not acceptable for a trans woman to attack a cis person (unless in self defence), but let’s not pretend that this happens often, because it doesn’t.","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"dylansmagicbox","id":97371867610,"post_url":"http://dylansmagicbox.tumblr.com/post/97371867610/so-like-ill-make-a-man-out-of-you-from-mulan-is","slug":"so-like-ill-make-a-man-out-of-you-from-mulan-is","type":"text","date":"2014-09-13 10:01:16 GMT","timestamp":1410602476,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"3OcKXWpc","tags":["i'll make a man out of you","mulan","trans","transmasculine","be a man","shang li","shang"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZOss_m1QhqCdQ","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":1,"title":"","body":"So like “I’ll Make a Man Out of You” from Mulan is like my theme song right now. \n\nBE A MAN. \n\nMakes me feel manly and shit. \n\nAnd the “hope he doesn’t see right through me” bit is like so perfect because passing sucks. University where I will study Media & Communications (and maybe Drama or English).\n\nI started testosterone (Nebido shot) on the 28th of July 2012. Initially it was every 12 weeks, but due to not having sufficient testosterone, it was changed to every 10 weeks earlier this year. Fortunately endocrinologist visits are free of charge but testosterone isn’t here and there is no scheme of insurance that safeguards trans individuals. I also had to pay for psychiatric evaluation privately since at hospital I had to wait months on the waiting list without being evaluated.\n\nTestosterone costs me 140 euros per shot, that’s about 700 euros a year. My only income currently is my student stipend, which is mostly spent on school material and bus fares, with occasional purchases of books. I also need to buy some compressing bras and an FTM swimsuit. I haven’t been to the beach in a long time and my last swim was two years ago in a small pool. I really feel insecure about the top part of my body but top surgery is out of the question at the moment since it costs too much, I would need to move out because my family doesn’t support me and I have no one to take care of me when I’d be weak from surgery.\n\nUnfortunately my first Indiegogo campaign proved unsuccessful because I only raised 1 euro.\n\nI have now made a new Indiegogo campaign for this same purpose. \n\nhttps://www.indiegogo.com/projects/help-me-pay-my-testosterone—2/x/6918674\n\nI would be very thankful if you lend me a hand and feel free to ask questions. I did some searching online and found a thread on a forum about this defect, where some people came together to talk about what the defect for them is like. This defect is physical. It’s usually obvious if you have it and it’s obvious if you don’t. There are minor cases that can be harder to diagnose, but there’s a certain point where you have it or you don’t. There’s no “I’m partly defected but party fine” just like there’s no “I’m half trans and half cis”. There’s no argument there. \n\nThis thread got popular and every fucking person without the defect decided to try and jump on the same ride. “My body is a bit like that. Do you think I have it?” or “[photo of someone who obviously doesn’t have the defect]. What do you all think? I have it but it doesn’t look as bad as yours.”\n\nThis is what has happened to being trans and this crap happens too much when trans people speak up to talk about their experiences.\n\nThere’s this “So because you’re trans, I must be too!” attitude.\n\nWhy does this attitude exist? They were drawn to “feminine” things, like dresses and dolls and make up. And while girls don’t have to even like feminine things, this royal felt like girl fit them better than boy. They always wished to be a girl since they were little.\n\nBut in their teens they learned more about trans people, and realized that if they identified as a girl, that would mean that they were a girl. They realized that they had always really been a girl.\n\nBut her parents would not hear of such things. Once she came out to them, they refused to accept that she was a girl and banned her from “feminine” things, thinking that would somehow stop her from being a girl. She was forced to remain in the closet, only ever revealing her true self to her best friend. She was forced to only learn and do things that her parents considered “boyish”. Sword fighting being the only one she actually enjoyed.\n\nSo the young princess grew up, unable to show her true self to her people. Sheltered by her parents. Her parents kept her hidden from the public as much as her parents could get away with. Her younger brother, on the other hand, they took great pride in.\n\nHe was the heir. He loved his sister and accepted her, but could not do much about how horrid their parents were.\n\nThe princess had to stay in the closet… Until one day…\n\nOn the way to a meeting with a neighboring kingdom (which she of course was not invited to, since her parents considered her the black sheep in the family), her parent’s train hit another train head on.\n\nHer parents were killed.\n\nShe was depressed for about a month, but then decided that she actually didn’t care much. Her parents never cared for her. They were ashamed of her. Their deaths would not change the mental abuse and transphobia they had shown her her entire life. They were not worthy of being called her parents. Their deaths did not mean that she owed them any respect.\n\nHer brother was more torn up about it, but finally got better after two months of mourning. Once he got out of his depression, he made a shocking proclamation:\n\n“There is no better person to rule this kingdom than Riley. They deserve it more than I do. I relinquish my rights to the crown to them.”\n\nRiley was shocked. A few weeks later, her brother left to fight in a war. He writes home sometimes.\n\nToday Riley is 17. She struggles with her gender identity. Now that her parents are gone, she is trying to regain the love for her real gender and overcome the transphobic insults, misgendering, and invalidation her parents had forced upon her.\n\nWill she come out to her subjects? Will she be able to be herself? Or will transphobia keep her in the closet? How will things work out for her?\n\nIn just two months, she will be crowned ruler of the kingdom. Will she stay in the closet and accept being crowned a king? Or will she accept who she really is, and take her rightful position as please message me.","body":"Or text me at 330 565 6084\n\nSignal boost please","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"subspacecow","id":97357143114,"post_url":"http://subspacecow.tumblr.com/post/97357143114","slug":"","type":"photo","date":"2014-09-13 04:22:39 GMT","timestamp":1410582159,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"EgNhq1U7","tags":["grindr","trans","transguy"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/Z4r_Tu1Qgy1nA","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":4,"caption":"","image_permalink":"http://subspacecow.tumblr.com/image/97357143114","photos":[{"caption":"","alt_sizes":[{"width":720,"height":1280,"url":"http://33.media.tumblr.com/a8f74115553e5dde6bd63a7a30124857/tumblr_nbto5rtYDB1reougxo1_1280.png"},{"width":422,"height":750,"url":"http://38.media.tumblr.com/a8f74115553e5dde6bd63a7a30124857/tumblr_nbto5rtYDB1reougxo1_500.png"},{"width":338,"height":600,"url":"http://33.media.tumblr.com/a8f74115553e5dde6bd63a7a30124857/tumblr_nbto5rtYDB1reougxo1_400.png"},{"width":225,"height":400,"url":"http://33.media.tumblr.com/a8f74115553e5dde6bd63a7a30124857/tumblr_nbto5rtYDB1reougxo1_250.png"},{"width":100,"height":178,"url":"http://38.media.tumblr.com/a8f74115553e5dde6bd63a7a30124857/tumblr_nbto5rtYDB1reougxo1_100.png"},{"width":75,"height":75,"url":"http://38.media.tumblr.com/a8f74115553e5dde6bd63a7a30124857/tumblr_nbto5rtYDB1reougxo1_75sq.png"}],"original_size":{"width":720,"height":1280,"url":"http://33.media.tumblr.com/a8f74115553e5dde6bd63a7a30124857/tumblr_nbto5rtYDB1reougxo1_1280.png"}}],"can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"popculturecatchall","id":97355493413,"post_url":"http://popculturecatchall.tumblr.com/post/97355493413/maybe-it-was-this-way-for-you-too","slug":"maybe-it-was-this-way-for-you-too","type":"text","date":"2014-09-13 03:57:00 GMT","timestamp":1410580620,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"y6R2sNLk","tags":["trans","trans women","transgender","memoir","personal","2nd person memoir","gwen araujo"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/Z-CYhu1Qgrl0b","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":2,"title":"Maybe it was this way for you too","body":"Maybe it was this way for you too. You hid it all and didn’t tell anyone else what was going on. But a little bit of courage built every day. And the conviction came that it was now and you were going to do… something. Maybe not shout it from the rooftops, but tell someone close. You were going to share your pain.\n\nMaybe it was this way for you too. Her name was Gwen and she was your age and she lived less than fifty miles away. At first she was missing, but there was no real doubt. She had been killed. She was seventeen. You were seventeen. She had been living as you wanted to and she was killed for that. They blamed their rage on her existence. These murderers so much like the boys you called friends. They buried her in the woods. You would only look up the news stories late at night after everyone else had gone to bed because there was only one computer and the whole family used it. You hid her pictures in a folder buried deep on the computer—a place no one else would ever even look—and erased your history. You would do the same the next night and the next and the next and the next and try to follow the case even though nothing changed and she was dead and that wouldn’t change. In your history class the only teacher you ever heard talk about this killing, who called it a tragedy, also called Gwen by the wrong name. You told no one.\n\nMaybe it was this way for you too. You realized there was no one to talk to about this. No one to mention this death that was so removed and so close to you. Gwen was dead and you never knew her but you wished you had. You weren’t part of the cool queer outcasts—a group of maybe two at your school. You were some stupid jock playing baseball and skipping class to go to the movies. You weren’t even supposed to know the word transgender. You were called fag only ever in a joking way—just like all the guys called each other—not with the menace of violence behind it. There was no way for them to know the fear you held.\n\nMaybe it was this way for you too. You had worn girls clothing, two sizes too small and stolen from your sister, under your jeans. You did this in September of 2002 but after October 3rd you never did it again. You went from being kind of a loner to having no friends at all. You felt close to no one. You skipped class even more. You wrote a short story in first person from a female perspective—but just as an exercise, you tell the classmates you didn’t realize would be reading it. You tried your best to control your voice and listen and hope they don’t notice your panicked sweat. You think of the frying pan they struck her with. The shovel they left to get and then used to strike her unconscious body. The rope they strangled her with. You know there’s no real chance of that but the images come to your mind because this was the only other seventeen-year-old trans girl in the world you’d ever heard of. It was just you and her and she was dead now and you were alone. Gwen you never knew.\n\nMaybe it was this way for you too. It was so easy being the withdrawn jock. Just play baseball and drive away to eat lunch each day. No one will ever ask more from you. Sure, you’re grades are too low to go to college even though everyone you know is applying. And yeah it’s not like you’re good enough at baseball to have a future there. Hell, you hardly see the field that year. You’re just some dumb C- student who will probably start working construction with your dad and brothers after high school. What else could you even hope for. What other option is there. You saw what happens when you let it out and show people. They buried it back down for you in a shallow grave.\n\nMaybe it was this way for you too. When you took the Army aptitude test you get a perfect score on their intelligence measure—it’s not really a hard test. You were never really dumb, just shitty at school, and everyone knew that so no one is surprised or anything. But when the recruiter comes and talks to you and asks you to sign papers and go in for a physical and mentions college it’s the first time you believe that escape is real and so even though it’s the last damn thing you want you sign up and after you do and the dread sets in you don’t understand that quitting is an option and you can walk away. You sign your letter to join the Army in March of 2003 and on the radio on the way back home with your father they announce that the first bombs have been dropped on Iraq. You are seventeen and have another year of high school left still, but it’s okay, they have a special program for you to start early.\n\nMaybe it was this way for you too. Your sense of doom and depression climb and climb and at least you stop actively thinking about her and how they killed her just for breathing. You move from station to station as the school year ends and boot camp begins and on the plane you hide the tears from the sleeping middle aged man next to you. You imagine elaborate fantasies of leaving almost upon arrival. The other recruits seem just as nervous and uncertain as you though and there’s at least some comfort in that. And by the time they drive you to camp you’re so lost that you wouldn’t even know which direction to flee. Eventually you find a map and you try to figure out how long you’d have before they would discover your empty bed and maybe it would be better to try and convince some other scared guy to make out but then everyone would think you were gay and you’ve convinced yourself that was worse than this. So you push through. You’re bright and athletic and used to hiding your emotions. You are very good at basic training, for whatever that’s worth.\n\nMaybe it was this way for you too. When you return people look at you weird. You are technically a soldier, but you’ve done nothing other than gone to a camp where some people yell at you for ten weeks. Your one friend, the one who was taking the damn test so you tagged along with in the first place, the one you don’t even really care about but he’s probably just as lonely as you and it’s easier to stand next to someone before school than no one, he’s joining the Marines after school’s out and so you talk about military stuff. That is until you freak out and drive 500 miles south before turning right around because you just need to leave. Your life gets put on pause in some ways—you don’t have to deal with school other than a half an hour in a small room out in the woods where a teacher asks you about what you’ve read lately and gives you some math worksheets. And you have to drive thirty miles one weekend a month to stand around and not know what to do while people work in an office and wear army fatigues. Eventually you just stop showing up to these and somehow this was all you needed to do to get discharged. Finally your passivity pays off. Of course you don’t know this at the time and you dread the eventual meetings and talks and is this even legal? Can they put you in prison for this? You don’t see why not.\n\nMaybe it was this way for you too. You graduate and start working at a lumber yard and everything seems back to the track you were on. But at the last minute you decide to attend the community college and sign up for whatever class you can. You get a really great English teacher in this accelerated pace class designed to help students transfer quicker. It is the perfect match for you. You’ve never done so well in school in your life—not even to the earliest years when you could never avoid trouble and would sometimes start crying if things went wrong. You even have a plan set that will free you from this place. You start to see the shape of a life that’s not so bad. Yeah, the depression and dysphoria come to visit you often, but at least in those other days it feels like you could maybe be okay. Not happy, but okay. You’ve never thought that was an option before.\n\nMaybe it was this way for you too. The life you were living was getting better and others seemed happy for you but you didn’t feel it at all. You constantly circled back to those trans thoughts and spent hours wandering down what-if paths. You wanted nothing more than to run away again from this good, respectable life you were building. You pushed away a woman you loved in no small part because you wanted and feared a future with her. You had to hide your thoughts from her and resented her for asking so often what is wrong. You couldn’t answer and said nothing and magnified her faults in your mind. And when you dump her you think it’s better and now you can find someone who will make you happy, even though you’ve never been happy.\n\nMaybe it was this way for you too. You saw it all clearly and the cycle was plainly shown. You realized it wasn’t going away. You are 28 and Gwen never got past 17, but she lived more than you ever have. And you know she wasn’t the only trans girl your age. You watch hours and hours worth of timeline videos on youtube and lurk reddit to see the beautiful trans girls who are your age and living proof that you were wrong and this can be done. You realize how much the death of Gwen was a product of the violence trans women of color face and how even though she lived near you and was your age you probably can’t relate to her experience. She faced a violence and oppression that you won’t know. Yet you still think of her and wonder if anyone else knows her name. How could you ever even begin to explain to someone just how important she was to your life. How could you ever begin to talk about her. What could you even say. She was born in the same year as you, nine months before you, and she was killed because she was a girl like you. You were just beginning to understand how real this was and name what it was. It was getting clear and you were thinking of ways to make it real and live that life and then they killed her for being a girl. That was the price. She was the only other trans girl in the world and they had killed her. But she wasn’t the only one. You were a trans girl too even if you ran from that and tried to ignore it into oblivion. You are trans and that never changes. You are trans and many others are too. You hid and you ran but that’s okay. You did what you had to survive and yeah it sucks that you weren’t really living your life for the last ten years like you could have been, but you’re here. You are twenty-eight and trans and a women and have hormones and all of that seemed so fucking impossible to you in October of 2002. You are alive and scared but ready to exist. It’s okay if it took you a while to get here, we’re just happy you did.\n\n—Emma","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"margaretshock","id":97355390909,"post_url":"http://margaretshock.tumblr.com/post/97355390909/meet-my-first-trans-woman-character-florence","slug":"meet-my-first-trans-woman-character-florence","type":"photo","date":"2014-09-13 It seems to Momma that you might not be so up-to-date on gender terms, and that’s totally fine! First, what do you mean she identifies physically as female? Are you saying she has female genitalia, or are you saying that she expresses her gender in female ways? (i.e. wearing dresses and makeup)\n\n  Secondly, get some information about pronouns. Does she WANT to use she, or would she prefer ‘they’ or other gender neutral pronouns such as ‘zir’? \n\nThirdly, it’s amazing that your mother is very accepting and approving- learn as a family and take this journey together! You zoomed in on ONE word in my entire ask. I used it mostly because there's a character limit. What I meant is that they haven't actually said \"I'm trans\", they would be deciding to say something, confirm it with them self, I guess. And, no, actually, I have never once told them that they shouldn't be trans or that its a bad thing. I haven't said anything negative to them on the subject at all. I also think that if that's what they really feel and want","answer":"[2/3] (okay I lied it was more than two) then they should absolutely go for it. Being my best friend, I WILL support them no matter what happens. I don’t want them to feel worse if that’s not what they really are in the end. No, I dont know them better than them self, but I do know them better than you. They can’t just say “Oh, I guess I was cis afterall.” and be fine. It would destroy them to be so wrong about something. One more point is that I have nothing against trans people at all. I don’t think that lots and lots of trans people are only like that from past trauma, I think they’re people who genuinely feel different than the set norm and make steps to be their true self, as you could say. No, I don’t know a super duper lot about trans people. I’ve never met one in my life. So, yes, I might say something that offends you, because I know language is really important to you. Its mostly because I don’t know what words and phrases you might use, so I’m sorry if I get it wrong.\n\nI’m glad to hear that you intend to support your friend whatever they may do, but I zoomed in on ‘one word’ for an important reason - trans people do not ‘decide’ to be trans, and that’s an important distinction to make. I’m glad that it was a result of limited space rather than thinking that we do ‘decide’ to be trans (as opposed to maybe making a decision regarding how & when we transition, which some of us do make a decision on), but I stand by my correction, because I couldn’t know unless you clarified.\n\nI don’t know why you came to me for help if you’re going to resist what I tell you. I appreciate that you’re not going to get the wording right all the time, but it’s still important to maybe find out a bit more about trans people and start learning the terminology, to help your friend, especially if they do realise they are trans.\n\nThe best thing for your friend, if they are questioning, is to let them question and to support them through it. Yes, they might realise they are not trans, and that might be a blow to them, but it’s still an important step for some people.","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"transoregon","id":97341034397,"post_url":"http://transoregon.tumblr.com/post/97341034397/theres-transmasculine-and-transfemine-groups-that-meet","slug":"theres-transmasculine-and-transfemine-groups-that-meet","type":"answer","date":"2014-09-13 00:28:00 GMT","timestamp":1410568080,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"UOpdpuSn","tags":["portland","q center","transmasculine","transfeminine","trans"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/Zs1ahw1Qf_a_T","followed":false,"post_author":"oddment-tweak","highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":1,"asking_name":"lionsmustroamfree","asking_url":"http://lionsmustroamfree.tumblr.com/","question":"There's transmasculine and transfemine groups that meet at the Q Center every week. I’m not excited about anything any more, I don’t enjoy anything, I don’t want to wake up in the morning, I don’t reply to messages, I don’t learn, I don’t feel like I have anything to add to the world in this state. They got the wrong cause though - they said it was other people’s opinions that changed me, but actually it’s the exhaustion of living a life that isn’t me.\n\nI need to be me, and I don’t care any more if I have to go to ten thousand appointments and walk across the country - cause this anhedonia is killing me.","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"haveagaydayorg","id":97339551813,"post_url":"http://haveagaydayorg.tumblr.com/post/97339551813/human-rights-victory-draws-close-for-transgender","slug":"human-rights-victory-draws-close-for-transgender","type":"link","date":"2014-09-13 00:06:37 GMT","timestamp":1410566797,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"fuNUEkop","tags":["lgbt","canada","transgender","human rights","trans"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZSWEKt1Qfux15","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":14,"title":"Human-rights victory draws close for transgender Canadians","url":"http://ottawacitizen.com/news/national/alex-neve-and-amanda-ryan-human-rights-victory-for-transgender-canadians","link_image":"http://38.media.tumblr.com/tumblr_nbtcb1CCU21s2gjqp_og.jpg","description":"Passed second reading; referral to committee. Did you not read the part where I said I'd support them? Nor did I say that they shouldn't explore their identity. The point was that they're having a very hard time in life, and we're close, so from what I understand about their problems, deciding to be trans RIGHT NOW would make them worse. I'm not \"throwing\" it at them, they're my best friend. Its a judgement based on intimate knowledge of their mind. Thanks for the calm discussion.","answer":"Yeah, you said you would support them but that right now you feel like it wouldn’t be healthy - the indication there is that you are not going to support them because you feel that it isn’t healthy. Also, no one ‘decides’ to be trans, that’s not how it works. If they’re having a hard time in life right now, I guarantee you that you are 100% not helping by questioning their gender identity and by assuming that you know their mind better than they do (you don’t).\n\nYou are being transphobic under the guise of being concerned. I don’t think you mean to be transphobic, I think it comes from a place of not knowing rather than maliciousness, but it doesn’t change the fact that this is what you are doing. No one ‘decides’ to be trans. Support your friend, unconditionally. Be there for them if they are trans, be there for them if they’re not.\n\nAlso, read this and do a little research on trans people.","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"muppetmolly","id":97338331974,"post_url":"http://muppetmolly.tumblr.com/post/97338331974/if-you-were-to-get-in-an-accident-and-suddenly","slug":"if-you-were-to-get-in-an-accident-and-suddenly","type":"quote","date":"2014-09-12 23:48:00 GMT","timestamp":1410565680,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"NWeAEt1u","tags":["trans","transgender","lgbtqia"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/Zbsbpt1QfqHD6","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":13,"text":"If you were to get in an accident and suddenly lose your penis, are you any less of a man? Are you now a woman because you don’t have a penis? You would simply reply “No I am a man! My brain tells me so!” \n\nThat is how transgender people feel. Their brain is telling them that the outside appearance of their body does not fit how they feel on the inside, if you can grasp this simple concept then you can grasp how we feel.","source":"Comment Booth"}}],"can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"hopeandvirtue","id":97331703569,"post_url":"http://hopeandvirtue.tumblr.com/post/97331703569/exposition","slug":"exposition","type":"text","date":"2014-09-12 22:14:00 GMT","timestamp":1410560040,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"N6Yrscs5","tags":["personal","trans","trans ally","trans partner","trans love","genderqueer","love","lgbtqia"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZA6oTr1QfQ_yH","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":0,"title":"Exposition","body":"I love how I have more certainty selecting the color scheme for this blog than I do writing in it. When did the lines between verbal and written expression start to blur? I mean, half my life has been spent orating, whether it be at my job, to my friends or to myself as I sit alone in the car. But now, as I sit in front of a keyboard, I struggle to articulate this tangled mass of emotions I have trapped inside. Not to say that it’s any easier, trying to sort through it aloud. But at least in that respect I can bullshit my point across… At least, I can most days.\n\nFake it until you make it, right? That’s what my dear old Dad used to say.\n\nNo, for the most part I’m totally and utterly blocked. Which sucks, especially considering the fact I have a new love vibrating in my chest, bouncing from corridor to corridor, urging to be free. Maybe that’s where all this tangible, physical pain is coming from? (At least, I like to joke that way in my head.) But seriously. It’s storybook love, the kind I haven’t felt since high school - that shout it from the rooftops kind of reaffirming love. And guess what? \n\nHe’s trans*.\n\nWhich is not of course, the defining aspect to his character. Oh no, when I think of Alec, I think of those fertile blue-green eyes set against his alabaster skin, or the way his dark hair falls when he tips his head against the pillow. Or the way he knows instictively how to curve his lips to mine in a way I haven’t felt all my life. I mean, for fuck’s sake, I was with Jamie for four or five years and not once did he try to adapt to me. No, I was the one forced to change, mold, adapt. But with Alec, I for once feel free. I feel closer and closer to being… Me.\n\nBut he’s trans*. Which poses a small problem.\n\nNot for my Dad, gods bless him. Despite his total inadequacy as a parent, I will eternally credit him for being my best friend. “As long as you’re happy, I’m happy,” he said. He could care less. In fact, my non-binary gender sort of lends itself well to Alec, which is something he noted later on. And you know, it poses no problems for my immediate friends, either. They all adore him. No, the only concern I have is in relation to my super religious co-workers and even then (as I try to be the best ally I can) I of course, refuse to out him. But he doesn’t pass well. After all, he came out for the first time in March. They haven’t met him. All they know is that I’m seeing a guy named Alec and as far as I’m concerned, that’s all they need to know.\n\nBut still. I love him! I want to take him to our work christmas party and show him off in a vest and tie. I want to declare in front of God and everyone that this is the person for me. But I’m not the issue. It’s about making him feel comfortable. I’d rather stab myself in the leg than see him misgendered. slandered or abused.\n\nAnd then there is a whole other issue in the form of my best friend Amber. She saw my graceful departure from Jamie a few months back and as I suspected, began to feel the same. Now, she’s having doubts about her own boyfriend. But.. They’re presenting themselves in the form of another. Like, another guy. And I hate to watch her do this to herself and to him. Eric is a good person. Jobless? Sure. Sometimes callous with a complete and utter lack of motivation? Sure. But who isn’t twenty-something and at least a little bit like that? I certainly have no room to talk, at least when it comes to motivation. But he’s also loyal, patient, considerate and kind. Were she to work up the courage to talk to him about it, I’m more than certain they might’ve worked through some of these issues. But instead she was afraid. And now, the love very well may be gone.\n\nBut wait! There’s more. I have axillary swelling under my armpit that is totally mysterious. Chest pain that comes and goes. Blood work? Fine. Ultrasound? No lumps! Gee, I wonder what’s wrong with me? WHO KNOWS? Not my doctor, that’s for sure.\n\nBut the drinking certainly helps… As does the cymbalta. Or at least, it seems to be helping.\n\nAnyway, that’s all for now. Maybe I’ll write a little bit about Alec later if the spirit takes me.","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"whothefisscott","id":97331620211,"post_url":"http://whothefisscott.tumblr.com/post/97331620211/hey-can-we-destroy-the-idea-that-only-trans","slug":"hey-can-we-destroy-the-idea-that-only-trans","type":"text","date":"2014-09-12 22:13:20 GMT","timestamp":1410560000,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"0WadI428","tags":["gender","pronouns","trans","nonbinary","preferred pronouns","neutrois","agender","genderqueer"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/Zppeas1QfQgbp","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":48,"title":"","body":"Hey, can we destroy the idea that only trans people should give their preferred pronouns? After living in a hazy, post traumatic state for over two decades, it feels strange to stop for a moment and realize that I’m safe. There are moments, still, when I can feel that unspoken tension between myself and another. For a moment it feels like our spirits, in some other realm, are battling. There is the chaos, the smoke of judgment, the shrieking whistle of preconception. A checkout line has become a battlefield.\n\nAnd I know of course that much of this is my own projection. My own defensiveness. And so I’ve begun to forgive myself. And them. \n\nInstead of battling what I assume to be their words, I battle my own. I combat every harsh critique with a kind utterance, parry each perceived insult with compassion. My head is often spinning with darkness. Years of anger and bitterness have built to an uncertain, internal cacophony. But I will speak over each negative voice, let my mental narrative burst with love and kindness. With patience, I will build a chorus of light within me that beats back the darkness. \n\nI will learn to forgive.\n\nIt isn’t their fault they cannot see me. It’s just the world they know.\n\nAnger drains me. Forgiveness and patience fuel GMT","timestamp":1410549180,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"nWAt6LWh","tags":["trans","lgbt","sexuality"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZYHEZq1Qeexf4","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":5,"title":"","body":"I should clarify because I feel like I haven’t been clear.\n\nI object to the sexuality=sex you’re into argument because\n\nIt reduces people down to their genitals (“I’m into women and trans men!” being the example I pull usually)\nIt makes the assumption relationships are about sex\nOf course, secondary sex characteristics are also important, and frankly, lesbians are going to be into female secondary and primary sex characteristics, and people who have those are women both in sex and gender in the overwhelming majority of cases. \n\nSo in a way it’s about sex but in a way it’s also not. It’s about perceived sex much more than birth sex. \n\nAnd then you get into the nuances of type, of personality overriding attraction, of gender overriding attraction, etc and so forth. \n\nOf course this is all a pedantic hair-splitting argument since, again, trans people are the exception and not the rule.","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"alistaireandhobbes","id":97316931328,"post_url":"http://alistaireandhobbes.tumblr.com/post/97316931328/1-week-on-t-first-home-injection","slug":"1-week-on-t-first-home-injection","type":"text","date":"2014-09-12 18:48:07 GMT","timestamp":1410547687,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"8DRHwTI4","tags":["ftm","trans","testosterone","T shot","1 week"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZVGwIs1QeYeS0","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":2,"title":"1 Week on T + First Home Injection","body":"So I’m officially 1 week on T today, and gosh golly gee does that feel weird to say…or type, I guess. I just said it aloud to myself to see if it feels weird to say, and it’s mostly weird to hear because I haven’t talked in the last 3 hours, and my voice squeaked. But that’s from not using it, not from the T. I’m not that delusional. \n\n<!-- more -->Obviously because it’s the first week, there ain’t a whole lot going on. It’s gonna take a while for the T to get built up in my system and for me to start seeing anything. I can wish and hope that my peach fuzz looks fuzzier, but I know that’s probably just the lighting in my bathroom being nice to me.\n\nI also gave myself my first at-home shot. That was definitely nerve wracking, though I told myself I couldn’t do anything else (like have lunch) until it was done, and I’m a rather food driven critter, so I got it taken care of. \n\nI definitely wasted a little bit of T trying to draw it out. I keep forgetting that the T is as syrupy as it is, so it takes a while to come out of the vial. But that also confuses me because it doesn’t take that long to inject. Weird. I was mostly scared shitless of getting an air bubble in the syringe and killing myself, so I double, triple, and quadruple checked that there weren’t any air bubbles. I foresee that being the thing my anxiety fixates on as this becomes a habit, because I’m already still mildly panicky over it. \n\nActually putting the needle in my thigh wasn’t that bad. It actually hurt less than most shots I’ve had in my arm. I pulled up on the plunger to see if I hit a vein, and there was no blood, so all in all, I’d say it was a good first shot. Though, I’m bleeding a little bit, because my hands were so shaky and I didn’t pull the needle out as quickly or as smoothly as I should have. But live and learn, right?\n\nFollowing putting the band aid on, I decided to grab the box that I usually store my kit in. As someone who struggles/ed with self-harm (like 95% of everyone else on this website), I was pretty ritualistic in where I kept my medical supplies and sharp objects. But i decided it was time that that box had a new use, so I cleaned it out and put my T vial in there, along with extra band aids and alcohol swabs. I’m actually pretty lucky I’ve got a decent stock of decent medical supplies, because the pharmacy only gave me syringes, no swabs or anything else. I think I might buy Batman band aids the next time I go to town, just as a treat for myself, because I’m really just an overgrown child. \n\nSo yeah, that’s week 1. Can’t wait to see what the next few will be like!","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"feministroosterteeth","id":97316886086,"post_url":"http://feministroosterteeth.tumblr.com/post/97316886086/i-really-hate-how-people-make-fun-of-the-way-famous","slug":"i-really-hate-how-people-make-fun-of-the-way-famous","type":"answer","date":"2014-09-12 18:47:23 GMT","timestamp":1410547643,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"h3IdCmVY","tags":["Anonymous","body positivity","social justice","trans","transgender","transmisogyny","misogyny","sexism","frtasks"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZHQdjr1QeYTP6","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":6,"asking_name":"Anonymous","asking_url":null,"question":"I really hate how people make fun of the way famous women look when just because they're problematic. Like, say this woman says a trans-misogynistic thing, and that's horrible, it 100% is and there is no denying that, but to make fun of her and say her face looks like or her body looks like is awful. We're all problematic, some more than others, but to rip a woman to shreds with 'her face is ugly' and things like that just doesn't sit well with me at all. sorry for that :(","answer":"I don’t know if you’re referencing a particular thing. I agree that no one should go after anyone for their looks, but it’s also important to remember that trans women are told that they’re unattractive constantly, so there’s an edge of backlash there. Body positivity does mean accepting ALL people as they are, no matter how they look, but let’s not focus primarily on criticising trans women for this, as they are primarily the victims of this (more often than to me said about one of her best friends, who is genderqueer, and identifies as “they”, and how this person gets bullied like, a lot. i was the only other person in the room who understood what genderqueer meant. in a room of about 25-30 people. i find this kind of gross, because people are just so ignorant of other identifies and it makes me sad. \n\nthen me and this girl talked about Martine Rothblatt, the highest-paid female executive in America, was born male. But that is far from the thing that defines her. Just ask her wife. Yes this is worth the time.\n\n“The highest-paid female CEO in America, earning $38 million last year, is Martine Rothblatt, the founder of United Therapeutics, a pharmaceutical company. Previously, Rothblatt founded Sirius Satellite Radio, but back then, Rothblatt lived as a man. She had sex-reassignment surgery in 1994 and, soon after, published a “slim manifesto that insisted on an overhaul of ‘dimorphic’ (her word) gender categories.” Rothblatt’s gender both doesn’t matter at all and matters entirely to everything she does. Her ambitions are inextricably tied to what’s closest to her as well as the seemingly impossible. United Therapeutics, which was founded after her daughter was diagnosed with a rare disease, aims to do nothing less than use “blue-sky technology to extend life.” Rothblatt is also into artificial intelligence and has created a robot version of her wife. In the end, New York Magazine’s Lisa Miller provides us with a CEO profile unlike any other, but not necessarily one to gawk at. I think a lot more before saying anything if given the option, and end up caught inside my head if left alone with the situation. My road rage has tamed a bit, I think. The thing is, from what I know about them they're saying these things/feeling this way because of past trauma, and it's like they don't want to be their gender because they don't feel safe. If they really felt that way and said something more, I would support them, but I feel like as of now it would be for unhealthy reasons, and I wouldn't want that. Does that make sense?","answer":"No. Not really. The whole ‘you’re only doing this because past trauma’ thing is thrown at trans people soooo much, and it’s really fucked up. Don’t define us (or our gender) by our past experiences. Also, even if your friend is uncomfortable with their gender because of past trauma, refusing to support them in that because it’s ‘unhealthy’ is really shitty. There’s nothing unhealthy about exploring one’s gender identity - that’s how we discover ourselves.\n\nSupport your friend. I understand; he’s a worrier, he’s a pessimist, he’s a what-if guy.\n\nBut to say it hurts is an understatement. I’m trying to be supportive of him so that he can be supportive of me in turn. But I feel like I’m being pulled apart by two halves of myself. He is a part of me. I love him more than anything or anyone on this planet. But at the same time my own skin is a discomfort to me. How can I choose one over the other?\n\nHe seems less stressed for having told me his worries. I’m right back into fear mode. His initial acceptance pulled me out of that, and to yank that rug out from under me has me spiraling into panic.\n\nFor now I’m going to ask him to at least try with me, and to visit a gender therapist with me. I think his fears are unfounded; I think he’s simply digging himself into the what-ifs because that’s what he always does when faced with uncertainty. But even if I do transition, it takes time, and that’s all I can give him right now: time to I’m back at my house whether or not I like it now, but I feel better and not suicidal. \n\nSo far, these past two days in which I have realized I’m trans have been the worst and the best days of my life. really supportive of me up until I went full-time in April.\n\nBut the first time I saw her after going full-time, she walked straight past me without even saying Hi. And the time after that. Every time I saw her, she wouldn’t even make eye contact with me.\n\nThis afternoon when I went to pick up the kids from a birthday party she was sitting on a bench by herself, so I decided to talk to her about it. I walked up, sat down next to her and started the conversation.\n\nMe: Hi\n\nHer: Hi\n\nMe: How have you been? It’s been ages since we talked.\n\nHer: Oh My God! I realized last night that I’ve been feeling my chest recently, as if to make sure that they’re not still there, that my body is no longer a prison. I love the feeling of fabric against my skin! A breeze blew against my shirt yesterday and I realized that I haven’t felt the sensation in a long time. It was new, almost like I’d never felt it before, like it was far away before and now it’s mine. I can’t wait until it heals more and the scars fade more, they look amazing now though. I feel so beautiful.\n\n I have been having a hard time with my belly recently. My whole body has changed because I wore the long compression top from Underworks (as well as a tri-top over it) and my tummy was compressed as well. Now, nothing is compressed and my belly is a brand NEW thing. My whole torso has changed drastically, not just my chest itself. It’s hard but I am working on loving it because I am beautiful and I need to remember that I feel like this at times when I feel like this is untrue.\n\n My body is my home and no longer my prison, I love my chest and loving my chub belly will come in time. I feel beautiful, my home is beautiful. How open & big is the trans* community there?","answer":"I personally have never lived anywhere other than Portland so I can’t really compare it to communities in other cities. I can get you started with a few relevant things in town: both PSU and PCC have some resources for trans and GNC students; the Trans and/or Women’s Action Camp is planned locally and held nearby annually; the Q Center hosts trans groups; there was a trans pride march at Pride this year (the photos from that event might help answer your question more eloquently than I can).
