[{"blog_name":"atranspaige","id":97051189556,"post_url":"http://atranspaige.tumblr.com/post/97051189556/new-narratives-2014-a-needed-breath-of-fresh-air","slug":"new-narratives-2014-a-needed-breath-of-fresh-air","type":"text","date":"2014-09-09 12:05:00 GMT","timestamp":1410264300,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"Zlokr7Sg","tags":["transgender","trans","transsexual","trans activism","new narratives","NN2k14"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZoCmnm1QOiw4q","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":21,"title":"New Narratives 2014: A Needed Breath of Fresh Air","body":"I mentioned it before, I was one of the people who attended New Narratives. There’s already a couple of excellent posts,about NN2k14 from two of the organizers, Snowflakeespecial and Mindergenfield, that you can read. \n\nI wasn’t one of the organizers, so I can’t really tell you about the goals of the event or if it should be considered a success. I wasn’t even one of the good people who took notes. What I can tell you is my personal thoughts and feelings from NN2k14.\n\nIt was amazing!\n\nI was surprised at how quickly I became comfortable around everyone there. In many ways New Narratives felt more like a support group than the trans support group I had attended. I actually felt safe to talk and voice my opinions. \n\nIt’s a good thing too because we talked and talked and talked. We talked so much that even after it was over several of us went to a bar and talked for like 2 hours more!\n\nYou’d think with all that talking that we would have come to some sort of consensus, but no. The only consensus was when we already agreed with each other.\n\nMostly New Narratives was a chance to air my grievances with certain aspects of the trans community; share my story with people I felt would actually listen and could understand; and gain some new perspective from listening to other people talk about their life and being a trans woman.\n\nMost importantly to me, it was a chance to do all this in person. Writing online is great. It’s let me talk to so many people across the globe that I’d have never met in my lifetime otherwise. Still real conversations are lessened when they only occur online. There’s something missing when you can’t see someone’s face. When you can’t hear the emotion behind their words. I’m sure there’s some people who would describe it as better and more “rational” that way. I don’t know about you, but rational does not describe the internet I’ve been on. \n\nWe didn’t just talk that day. In fact the thing I remember best was when we did a group walking meditation. It seemed a little silly, but it also felt good. It was supposed to help reconnect with your body, and I think it could it could really help. There were a few times I had to stop myself from laughing though. I couldn’t help it, I just started picturing some random person walking by and seeing a group of people walking in circles with their eyes closed.\n\nOnce everything was said and done, well everything that could be said in a day, I was really glad I’d gone. I loved New Narratives. I made some new friends there. It’s what pushed me to start this blog and actually start talking to some people in real life about the problems within the trans community. If it hadn’t happened, I’d have probably left the trans community completely, slowly gone semi-stealth, and just tried to ignore everything that was going on.\n\nTo the organizers, thank you so much for putting on New Narratives. I can’t wait for the next one; I’ll definitely be there.","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"slutwatpizzabutt","id":97050466701,"post_url":"http://slutwatpizzabutt.tumblr.com/post/97050466701/tie-tuesday-i-think-this-is-my-fav-tie","slug":"tie-tuesday-i-think-this-is-my-fav-tie","type":"photo","date":"2014-09-09 11:47:58 GMT","timestamp":1410263278,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"KW51ZF54","tags":["tie Tuesday","ties","fashion","trans","slutwatpizzabutt"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZmWyRy1QOg9cD","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":7,"caption":"Tie Tuesday. And as I’ve mentioned before, there’s definitely a sexual aspect to my transition even without sexualizing it, so I don’t mind including the transition in my fetish/sexual-fantasy materials. \n\nIt’s problematic for me, though, because the term comes with a LOT of baggage concerning interests, mostly surrounding men’s dicks. I seriously don’t understand what is so important about this, but it’s so fucking impossible to avoid. I wouldn’t be averse to sex with someone presenting as female who has a penis, sure, but that’s a long way from the obsession that the “sissy” fetish materials present. So I’m nervous about reblogging things that actually include the word “sissy” regardless of how well they apply to me or my desires otherwise. And to be frank, it’s hard to find things that connect to me when they’re covered in phalluses (phalli?). I can’t even stand my favorite things for that long, and I have to put up with this bullshit to get to things that I actually like. It’s really fucking X","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"notyourqueertheoryposterchild","id":97043202015,"post_url":"http://notyourqueertheoryposterchild.tumblr.com/post/97043202015/hi-first-i-am-a-cis-heterosexual-16-year-old-girl-and","slug":"hi-first-i-am-a-cis-heterosexual-16-year-old-girl-and","type":"answer","date":"2014-09-09 08:09:00 GMT","timestamp":1410250140,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"oQAZ9085","tags":["trans","truscum","transgender"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/Zerdxn1QOER-V","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":17,"asking_name":"Anonymous","asking_url":null,"question":"Hi! First, I am a cis heterosexual 16-year-old girl and I am very new to all these concepts, so I think it would be great if you could do like an explanation post? Or redirect me to one you consider informative and well enough explained so that I, someone who has never experienced any of this, can get in touch with the subject for a first time. (+)","answer":"(-) I don’t really worry about other people’s sexualities and genders as long as they’re happy with themselves (and I would want to help the fight you’re all giving from my position as much as possible) but it would be awesome to understand it because if I understand it maybe I can make other people understand and maybe stand from a less (unacknowleding) transphobic position? Idk. Anyways, thank you! :)\n  _______\n  Hi! Not sure how specific you’re wanting but I’ll give a quick run through of the basics and add a few helpful links. It’s always nice when allies want to help.\n\n  First off, a few distinctions should be made.\n\nSex- one’s physical attributes which distinguishes them as male, female, or in the case of intersex people, somewhere in between (there is a wide variety of intersex conditions, but that is another topic for someone more informed on them such as prototran).\n\nGender - how one’s mind perceives what sex they should be. When one’s mind perceives they should be neither male or female they are agender. When one’s mind perceives they should be both simultaneously, they are bigender.\n\nNonbinary- genders other than male or female\n\nGender roles - societal roles based on one’s gender. As society in most cases does accept non binary genders, there are no roles for bigender or agender people. This is just as well as gender roles are basically society/culture wide stereotypes and I think we can all pretty much agree stereotypes suck.\n\nGender non conforming - cis and trans people who don’t conform to gender roles\n\nTrans - people whose gender does not match their sex.\n\nDysphoria - the feeling one gets when their sex and gender do not match. It can vary anywhere from a mild disconnect to a hatred of sex characteristics. It can also manifest as disassociation or depression.\n\nPrimary sex characteristics - sex characteristics pertaining to the reproductive system\n\nSecondary sex characteristics - Characteristics that are basically side effects of sex hormones, suxpch as amount of facial/body hair, size of hands, facial structure, breasts or lack of and so on.\n\n  Sometimes it can be tempting to ask trans people invasive questions out of curiosity but always consider first if you would ask a cis person the same question and if the question could possibly trigger the trans person’s dysphoria. Before delving into their personal life, ask yourself if you really need to and ask them what they’re comfortable talking about if anything.\n\nQuestion that would be helpful to ask a trans person would be things like “what topics should I avoid around you to make sure you’re comfortable?” (A good question to ask any friend really, trans or not) “who are you out to/what gender should I refer to you as with who?” (To avoid outing them and making situations unsafe for them) and similar things.\n\n  An important thing to remember is that gwhile gender dysphoria can lead to hatred of sex charectistics gender dysphoria =/= self hate. Body dysmorphia and gender dysphoria are very different things and I think this link describes the differences well- http://amydentata.com/2012/03/06/the-difference-between-dysphoria-and-negative-body-image/\n\nA simple guide on how to respect trans people: http://m.wikihow.com/Respect-a-Transgender-Person\n\nFor those dating a trans person (it was written specifically for those dating trans men but can easily cover other transgender partners): http://theartoftransliness.com/post/5017698937/how-to-love-and-support-your-ftm-partner-or-your-soffa\n\n  If you’d like to help support trans artists, here’s our pages for that (and if you know anyone we can add, please let us know. We’re also open to adding other minority artists/authors/etc.): http://notyourqueertheoryposterchild.tumblr.com/trans%20artists\n\nhttp://notyourqueertheoryposterchild.tumblr.com/tagged/support\n\nIn comparison to gender, sexuality is a bit more straightforward, especially when keeping it simple and general.\n\nIt’s what gender you’re attracted to.\n  Heterosexual - attracted to the opposite sex/gender\n  Homosexual - attracted to the same sex/gender\n  Bisexual - attracted to two or more genders\n  Asexual - sexually attracted to no one\n\nAsexual people can still be romantically attracted to people, just not sexually attracted. They can have relationships. I’m an asexual trans person in a relationship with a cis hetero man.\n  Bisexual people can have preferences of one gender over another.\n\nAnother person you can ask about these things is genderspatial, he’s pretty knowledgeable, and if you have more specific questions, I’m open to answering more.\n\n***\n\nI (Wulver. ohai.) would like to add some tidbits.\n\nIf someone whose gender is masculine/male is “gender nonconforming,” that does not mean he is transgender. If someone’s gender is feminine/female, but they are physically male, and YET, they are still more socially masculine, that doesn’t mean they are not transgender. Gender and gender ROLES are two separate things.\n\nIf a woman is very socially masculine, but her gender is still feminine/female, she’s not trans just because she is gender nonconforming.\n\nFor a real example - I am a transgender man. My body is female, and I have the dysphoria (disconnect, which is unsettling, but not the same as hate - I’m pretty darn pretty, I just am disconnected and it’s not the place I feel I should be) and yet, I’m still socially feminine. The gender role says that if I’m female, then I have a certain place in society and have a socially stereotypical way to act, think, and talk, etc.\n\nBut because my gender is not female/feminine, that contributes to people not taking me seriously whenever I talk about this kind of thing. I may like to sew and art and cook and do my hair (like the stereotypical woman) but my brain still tells me, through dysphoria (again, not hate, just disconnect) that things aren’t quite right. I’m trans when I’m doing my makeup. I’m trans when I’m squealing like a little girl over something. I’m trans when I’m shopping and cooking and picking out my clothes out of a huge collection.\n\nI’m done. Just wanted to clarify that point because it seems it’s one of the points people have a particularly hard time with.","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"insidethechrysalis","id":97042721223,"post_url":"http://insidethechrysalis.tumblr.com/post/97042721223/had-my-first-transgender-support-group-meeting-in","slug":"had-my-first-transgender-support-group-meeting-in","type":"text","date":"2014-09-09 07:53:32 GMT","timestamp":1410249212,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"rurA6YMV","tags":["trans","transgender","ftm","support group"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZCAA0s1QOCcd7","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":0,"title":"","body":"Had my first transgender support group meeting in a long time.\n\nThen I get home and dad has a go at me because for some reason he thinks he is entitled to know the birth sex of the people running the group, and doesn’t think that me refusing to tell him is fair.\n\nAll you have to know is who they identify as now. The rest doesn’t matter to you. Kindly get that through your skull, and stop yelling at me for respecting my fellow transgendered people.","can_reply":false}]

mean those fucking things. I honestly, from the bottom of my fucking heart, only meant that we shouldn’t get caught up in what type of body different people have because every body is fucking precious and worth celebrating and every human (or non human, or non mammal, or whatever the fuck) body does amazing things.\n\nYOU DON’T HAVE TO BE CIS TO HAVE A BODY THAT DOES AMAZING THINGS. I can’t remember the name very well but it was at a knife-cut noodle restaurant.\nThere were a lot of people so I was standing in line when I saw someone who looked like June.\nSince it might not be June, I just stared, but suddenly he called “B.I! [{"blog_name":"techska","id":97037747825,"post_url":"http://techska.tumblr.com/post/97037747825/im-a-little-curious-on-how-to-convince-my-parents","slug":"im-a-little-curious-on-how-to-convince-my-parents","type":"text","date":"2014-09-09 05:48:37 GMT","timestamp":1410241717,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"PxXlb4cg","tags":["transman","transmasculine","trans","trans questions","acceptance","questions"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZDd8Ot1QNvePn","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":1,"title":"","body":"I’m a little curious on how to convince my parents to start using my desired pronouns and crap. My dad’s blowing his shit at me because I’m not comfortable acting or looking “Female”. \n\nI was always told to let the man handle it, to stay away from the tools and learn how to cook. Reprimanded for not knowing how to clean, and praised when I was able to do theatrical makeup simply because it was makeup. Now that I’m out these traits I was put down for are suddenly more desirable. I’m a techie on the drama club, in the robotics team, in a STEMs school, and now working on cold fusion. Why is it that if I happened to think that I was a female that I would be frowned upon? Why is playing with the neighbors’ kids suddenly okay?\n\nAnd yet, my parents will still correct people when they call me male. Even complete strangers still get a tongue lashing. Just the other day I was at the vet’s office, crouching down to check on one of the animals. I was asked politely to move so someone could get past me, and this person added the formality “young man,” to the end. I was pretty pleased, but my mother felt the need to stop this man and correct him, saying I was biologically female, and then proceeded to point at my chest. \n\nNow, I love my mother to death. She’s a very sweet person and a huge factor as to why I’m still around, but holy fucking shit did that hurt. I was out to her, and she still found the need to call me “Her little girl” and buy dresses and offer to enroll me in Girlscouts. It’s the same thing with my father, only without the passive-aggressiveness and mutual caring. Why do parents feel the need to try and change something that’s already set in stone? You can’t melt the stone down and reforge it. You can weather it, crumble it. Take the dust and put it under pressure so it reforms, but that isn’t the same rock. It has a different composition, and it’s much weaker than it was before. \n\nI just want to know how to talk to them without being ignored.","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"yunhoparadise","id":97037455075,"post_url":"http://yunhoparadise.tumblr.com/post/97037455075/trans-night-watchman-jung-yunho-the-tears-acting","slug":"trans-night-watchman-jung-yunho-the-tears-acting","type":"text","date":"2014-09-09 05:42:37 GMT","timestamp":1410241357,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"1Br3Aiwh","tags":["tvxq","dbsk","yunho","trans","proud fan here"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZyyEdr1QNuWxZ","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":43,"title":"[trans] \"Night Watchman\" Jung Yunho, The \"tears acting\" which overpowered the controversy over his acting abilities","body":"*note - there are spoilers in this article.\n\n In the 11th episode of “Journal of Night Watchmen”, actor Jung Yunho has, through his “tears acting” filled with genuine emotions, overpowered the controversy over his acting abilities which had previously surrounded himself. \n\n -spoilers omitted-\n\nIn the past, Moo Seok’s sister was inflicted with smallpox and died while being watched over by Moo Seok. Moo Seok said while his tears spilled over, “It would be great if I had been the one who got inflicted instead. There is nothing I can do for you. Even when our mother and father passed away, there was also nothing which I could do for them”.\n\n In this scene, Jung Yunho, who takes on the role of Moo Seok, let loose an explosive outburst of emotions when faced with the death of his sister, and displayed his smooth flowing acting abilities. Through his “tears acting” which captured the attention of viewers and his heart-wrenching gaze, it was sufficient to stimulate the tear glands of the viewers.\n\n In the past, Moo Seok consistently faced everybody and everything around him with a cold and serious attitude, and appeared as a character wearing a veil over him. However, while the past of Moo Seok whereby he had lost his sister in childhood and deeply kept the hurt in his heart was revealed in this day’s episode, the sympathy of the viewers built up when faced with Moo Seok, who had naturally fastly closed the doors to his heart and lived a lonely life to this day.\n\n U-Know Yunho, who had made his debut through TVXQ’s single album “Hug” in 2004, held active activities as a singer and thereafter appeared in MBC’s Wednesday-Thursday drama “Heading to the Ground” in 2009 and last year’s SBS Monday-Tuesday drama “Yawang” etc, building up his filmography as an actor. However, compared to the full-time actors, he was caught up in controversy over his relatively weak emotive expressability and excessive gestures.\n\n Prior to this, at the production press conference for “Journal of Night Watchmen” held in Junifer Hall of the 63 Building in Yeongdeungpo, Yeouido, Seoul, on 29 July, regarding the controversy surrounding him as regards his acting abilities, he had revealed his strong ambitions, “It is my first time in a period drama, and having started out as an idol, I had heard a lot of various criticisms. I have said before that I want to become an actor who gradually grows / improves. I think that I should let my genuity-infused acting pick up through this production”.\n\n Jung Yunho has stamped on the controversy and he is resolutely attempting challenges in the new field of period dramas through “Journal of Night Watchmen”, showing his extraordinary courage. In this regard, he put in his never-ceasing hard work and effort (the Korean phrase literally means “blood-inducing effort”, i.e. putting in tremendous effort), and showed everybody his surprising growth, personally proving that he is progressing as an actor. This is the reason why one cannot help but pay attention to the growing phase of Jung Yunho, reborn as an actor from being an idol.\n\n.\n\nf: newsen | Trans by LG-F400L"}}],"can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"variegatedpoise","id":97036556198,"post_url":"http://variegatedpoise.tumblr.com/post/97036556198/we-need-a-national-conversation-about-transphobia","slug":"we-need-a-national-conversation-about-transphobia","type":"quote","date":"2014-09-09 05:24:00 GMT","timestamp":1410240240,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"Agkd8VIP","tags":["feminism","feminist","lgbtq","trans","trans*","gender","equality","racism"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/Z7sU4y1QNr5Uc","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":1,"source_url":"http://www.huffingtonpost.com/terry-oneill/why-transphobia-is-a-femi_b_5785820.html?ncid=fcbklnkushpmg00000046","source_title":"The Huffington Post","text":"We need a national conversation about transphobia, which dehumanizes, demeans and disadvantages a specific group of people. This is a feminist issue on two levels. First, like racism and homophobia, transphobia grows out of and helps perpetuate the same patriarchal ideology that dictates women’s subordination as second-class citizens. Second, transphobia disproportionately harms women.\n\nTrans women face higher rates of discrimination, violence, sexual assault, and poverty. Around half of all victims of anti-LGBTQIA homicides in 2012 were transgender, and all of them were women of color.\n\nBlack and African-American transgender women have a 50 percent greater homicide rate than their white, Latina, and Native American counterparts and were more than three times as likely to experience police violence more than any other group, according to a 2012 report by the National Coalition of Anti-Violence Programs on LGBTQIA and HIV Affected Hate Violence.\n\nThese are all civil rights violations because they are rooted in the denial of a person’s right to be who they are. Equal means equal. That includes equality for all women, not just a certain type of woman. Not just women who look like me!\n\nThe consequences of violating these fundamental rights are not just the alarming rates of homelessness, unemployment, access to health care, economic insecurity, depression and suicide, but also the weakening of the very fabric of our society.\n\nIt diminishes all of us when one type of person or group is targeted, and when they are denied the basic understanding, compassion and protection we all expect and deserve.","source":"From the article “Why Transphobia is a Feminist Issue.”\n\nTerry O’Neill President, National Organization for Women","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"edwarddequeer","id":97036554884,"post_url":"http://edwarddequeer.tumblr.com/post/97036554884/17-18-19","slug":"17-18-19","type":"answer","date":"2014-09-09 05:24:54 GMT","timestamp":1410240294,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"u6KTSFIh","tags":["personal","me","queer","gay","trans","books","death tw","suicide tw maybe","idk not exactly but i feel like i should probably tag it","notanotherprotagonist","ask","message","question"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZETyTv1QNr5A4","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":1,"asking_name":"notanotherprotagonist","asking_url":"http://notanotherprotagonist.tumblr.com/","question":"17, 18, 19?","answer":"17. favorite fairy tale?\n\nI think Hans Christian Andersen’s The Little Mermaid. I like the strength and the integrity of the little mermaid. She’s a very self-motivated, independent, driven character. And she sacrifices so much—not just her tail, not just all her life, but she sacrifices herself and her happiness and puts the happiness of the one she loves ahead of her own. She’s very hard-working and also a dreamer, someone who believes she can shape her own destiny, as impossible as it may seem. Idk it’s a very depressing fairy tale but I’ve always loved it. Also apparently it was supposed to be a metaphor for HCA’s own gay relationship, and I’ve also seen trans interpretations. So that just adds another queer layer that I like a lot.\n\n18. what would you do if you knew it was the last day on earth?\n\nFind my way back to Paige and spend every last second with her. If the world is ending, I’m not going out any way other than wrapped in her arms.\n\n19. is there anyone you would die for?\n\nObviously you can never really know unless you’re in that situation. But I think yes. Maybe I wouldn’t if I were actually faced with the possibility, but at this moment in time, definitely yes. Paige. Children I nanny/teach. My friends. Tbh I’d probably die for most people, I don’t think my life is worth very much compared to so many others. There are amazing people out there who are going to accomplish so much with their lives and I’m probably not like I’m pretty useless as a human being, so yeah I’d probably sacrifice myself for a lot of people. wow okay that came out a lot more suicidal than I intended, don’t worry about me, I’m not planning on actually putting this into action or anything. I wouldn’t really be able to live with myself if I knew I could have saved someone’s life and didn’t, also, so that’s another factor to consider.","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"weareone-blog","id":97036089213,"post_url":"http://weareone-blog.tumblr.com/post/97036089213/trans-140908-sm-choreographer-instagram","slug":"trans-140908-sm-choreographer-instagram","type":"photo","date":"2014-09-09 05:16:01 GMT","timestamp":1410239761,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"q2icKhrT","tags":["exo","exo-k","chanyeol","140908","trans","Sm","choreographer","instagram update","instagram","update","photo"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZnEEpr1QNpJTz","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":3,"caption":"[TRANS] 140908 SM Choreographer Instagram Update:\n\n\"Must be very busy… Thanks to our EXO for taking care of me ㅋ Lovely Chanyeoli~! #JonginaJoonmyunaSehunacanyouseethis”","image_permalink":"http://weareone-blog.tumblr.com/image/97036089213","photos":[{"caption":"","alt_sizes":[{"width":640,"height":640,"url":"http://33.media.tumblr.com/7a805148168a869cdffdbecca6c24f2b/tumblr_nbm053oXWO1sulky7o1_1280.jpg"},{"width":500,"height":500,"url":"http://38.media.tumblr.com/7a805148168a869cdffdbecca6c24f2b/tumblr_nbm053oXWO1sulky7o1_500.jpg"},{"width":400,"height":400,"url":"http://38.media.tumblr.com/7a805148168a869cdffdbecca6c24f2b/tumblr_nbm053oXWO1sulky7o1_400.jpg"},{"width":250,"height":250,"url":"http://38.media.tumblr.com/7a805148168a869cdffdbecca6c24f2b/tumblr_nbm053oXWO1sulky7o1_250.jpg"},{"width":100,"height":100,"url":"http://31.media.tumblr.com/7a805148168a869cdffdbecca6c24f2b/tumblr_nbm053oXWO1sulky7o1_100.jpg"},{"width":75,"height":75,"url":"http://33.media.tumblr.com/7a805148168a869cdffdbecca6c24f2b/tumblr_nbm053oXWO1sulky7o1_75sq.jpg"}],"original_size":{"width":640,"height":640,"url":"http://33.media.tumblr.com/7a805148168a869cdffdbecca6c24f2b/tumblr_nbm053oXWO1sulky7o1_1280.jpg"}}],"can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"lickyvobo","id":97036069367,"post_url":"http://lickyvobo.tumblr.com/post/97036069367/tomorrow-is-a-big-day-at-our-house-jackson-starts","slug":"tomorrow-is-a-big-day-at-our-house-jackson-starts","type":"text","date":"2014-09-09 05:15:00 GMT","timestamp":1410239700,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"Ymgr0sLJ","tags":["transgender","trans","ftm","transwife","testosterone","ourstory"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZDD2Qy1QNpEdt","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":0,"title":"","body":"Tomorrow is a big day at our house… Jackson starts testosterone!\n(I’m pretty sure I won’t be sleeping tonight.)\n\n It feels like it’s all happening so quickly, but it in reality, this has been a long time coming.\n\n Not long after Jax came out as trans, we began looking for a doctor who could help him start the process of transitioning. We found one doctor who decided Jax was just unhappy and needed some strong antidepressants. Needless to say we never saw him again. Living in such a small state, our resources felt limited as we continued to look for any sign of help.\n\n About two months ago, we found Amy Herb through our insurance provider, and since then, we’ve never looked back She instantly recognized the fact that Jax had been living as a man for the last five years and referred us to the Mazzoni Center in Philadelphia.\n\n We were able to expedite the process of starting testosterone treatments due to a cancellation at the Mazzoni Center. \n\n Now we’re on the eve of a huge turning point in our lives and I’m feeling conflicted. I am so happy we’ve finally reached the point where this is happening, but it doesn’t mean it’s easy. There’s an uncertainty, the fear of the unknown.\n\n But above all that I realize that I am in love with this person. If he looked at me tomorrow and told me he wanted to be a zebra with purple stripes and plaid hooves, I would still want to be with him forever. We’ve weathered so many storms, there’s no one that knows me better, and no one I would rather spend the rest of my life with.","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"jadeisthesanasa","id":97035837193,"post_url":"http://jadeisthesanasa.tumblr.com/post/97035837193/had-to-pull-out-my-glasses-so-i-could-read-a-bitch","slug":"had-to-pull-out-my-glasses-so-i-could-read-a-bitch","type":"photo","date":"2014-09-09 You wouldn’t just go with it. You wouldn’t say “okay, I’m (gender) now.” You would say “Oh no, my body’s wrong. I still feel like a (original gender).” Having the different body doesn’t change how you feel about your own gender, cause gender is only a feeling that you have. And just because we’re used to our bodies being how they are, doesn’t mean we’re comfortable with them.","source":"I hope this helps explain it a I’m an extremely qualified organizer and combat leader. I’m trained in survival, evasion, resistance, and escape. I’m an expert in most forms of armed and unarmed combat. I’m also a blacksmith, an archer, a hunter, an artist, and I have work experience in farming and construction.\n\n  I am the definition of the person you’d want on your team.\n\nBut in a post-apocalyptic scenario, I’d probably be suicidal or I’d lose my shit and become an animal.\n\nBecause in such a scenario I wouldn’t have access to hormones and I’d turn back into a testosterone-fueled werebeast.\n\nThe things I did pre-transition have been haunting me lately. credits)","image_permalink":"http://kissncryspain.tumblr.com/image/97028524627","photos":[{"caption":"","alt_sizes":[{"width":607,"height":610,"url":"http://38.media.tumblr.com/3de6c5b80091f40fce30a8cbd1216100/tumblr_nbm6s2FSke1tqjau6o1_1280.png"},{"width":500,"height":502,"url":"http://33.media.tumblr.com/3de6c5b80091f40fce30a8cbd1216100/tumblr_nbm6s2FSke1tqjau6o1_500.png"},{"width":400,"height":402,"url":"http://33.media.tumblr.com/3de6c5b80091f40fce30a8cbd1216100/tumblr_nbm6s2FSke1tqjau6o1_400.png"},{"width":250,"height":251,"url":"http://38.media.tumblr.com/3de6c5b80091f40fce30a8cbd1216100/tumblr_nbm6s2FSke1tqjau6o1_250.png"},{"width":100,"height":100,"url":"http://38.media.tumblr.com/3de6c5b80091f40fce30a8cbd1216100/tumblr_nbm6s2FSke1tqjau6o1_100.png"},{"width":75,"height":75,"url":"http://33.media.tumblr.com/3de6c5b80091f40fce30a8cbd1216100/tumblr_nbm6s2FSke1tqjau6o1_75sq.png"}],"original_size":{"width":607,"height":610,"url":"http://38.media.tumblr.com/3de6c5b80091f40fce30a8cbd1216100/tumblr_nbm6s2FSke1tqjau6o1_1280.png"}}],"can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"tonidorsay","id":97027341129,"post_url":"http://tonidorsay.tumblr.com/post/97027341129/what-is-microaggression","slug":"what-is-microaggression","type":"text","date":"2014-09-09 03:09:25 GMT","timestamp":1410232165,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"yoZg7wIN","tags":["What is","Feminism","Radical Feminism","Trans"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/Z6gxtx1QNHxj9","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":10,"title":"What is: Microaggression","body":"A Microaggression is a brief, everyday exchange that sends a denigrating messages to certain individuals because of their membership in a group that is typically not the speaker’s own.\n\nMicroaggressions happen predominantly as a part of every day speech, and are matched to membership in the respective member’s out-groups and in-groups.\n\nAMITAI ETZIONI is a professor of International Relations at George Washington University, and finds the notion of microaggressions to be annoying because, in their words, they are “just human nature”, citing sociological understanding of a social psychology and psychological concept that actually describes what he is saying is just human nature, and the negative effects thereby.\n\nIn fairness to him, he is more focused on international policy and tends to promote an idea of “post human rights”, so it isn’t exactly like he’s particularly good at these aspects. Just nosy enough to stick his nose into an area he knows little about. Which is notable since her refers to it as a new idea.\n\nThe idea of microaggressions was first broached by Harvard Professor Chester M Pierce, then later expanded by MIT Ombudsman Mary Rowe, and now covers a range of characteristics that describe the particulars of interpersonal communication.\n\nA key aspect to microaggressions is that they are not overt acts of hostility, but rather ones that happen without someone realizing it. This is what distinguishes a microaggression from outright discrimination. The user simply doesn’t know they are being a twerp, or, as described by Derald Sue Wing, “Microaggressions are considered to be different from overt, deliberate acts of bigotry, such as the use of racist epithets, because the people perpetrating microaggressions often intend no offence and are unaware they are causing harm.”\n\nMost perpetrators of microaggressions consider themselves to be unprejudiced, with one U.S. study finding that even mental health professionals with extensive antiracist training engaged in microaggressions with African-American clients.\n\nSO they are something that we see quite often, and on tumblr, the use of microaggressions is often met with sharp criticism and cries of racism, sexism, etc, in an unusual demonstration of expecting people to be fully versed in them and hyper vigilant about their own language.\n\nAn intersting thing about microaggressions is that deeply stigmatized people will even use them self referentially, and perpetuate the cycle even when they themselves are hyper aware of these things.\n\nThis is one of the aspects of internalization.\n\nmicroaggressions make them feel invisible, exhausted, frustrated, powerless, emotionally detached, helpless or tense.\n\nThey may also feel a pressure to conform, a loss of their own integrity, or a pressure to “represent” their group.\n\nOver time, the cumulative effect of microaggressions can lead to diminished self-confidence and a poor self-image, and potentially also to mental health problems such as depression, anxiety and trauma.\n\nMany researchers have argued that microaggressions are actually more damaging than overt expressions of bigotry precisely because they are small and therefore often ignored or downplayed, leading the victim to feel self-doubting rather than justifiably angry, and isolated rather than supported.\n\nOn the other hand, some people report that microaggressions have made them more resilient.\n\nResearch has shown that when women experience microaggressions, they may become depressed, develop low self-esteem, or experience sexual dysfunction. Some develop eating disorders and body image issues.\n\nResearch has shown that microaggressions can lead people of color to fear, distrust and avoid relationships with white people.\n\nThree commonly used forms of microaggression against trans people assert one of three aspects:\n\nBeing trans isn’t natural (trans women are men, it is a choice, etc)\nConflation with child abuse/Sexual abuse (trans women represent a threat to children/women)\nBeing Trans is sinful\nThe astute may note that the same three core concepts are used against most groups that are marginalized at some time or another (lesbians, gay men, women, Black people, etc).\n\nTumblr happens to house one of the most important collections of microaggressions on the web: http://microaggressions.tumblr.com/\n\nI heartily recommend you follow them.","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"autumn-in-washingtonsquaregarden","id":97027260373,"post_url":"http://autumn-in-washingtonsquaregarden.tumblr.com/post/97027260373/some-people-are-trans-some-people-are-cis-male-or","slug":"some-people-are-trans-some-people-are-cis-male-or","type":"photo","date":"2014-09-09 02:33:03 GMT","timestamp":1410229983,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"iHPjpgGE","tags":["ftm","f2m","me","trans"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZXWknx1QN67qd","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":9,"title":"//Life Update//","body":"Just booked an appointment to go and see the doctor to talk about medically transitioning. Appointment is on Wednesday… hopefully will get a referral. Ahhhhhhhhh!","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"findingdonovan","id":97024017936,"post_url":"http://findingdonovan.tumblr.com/post/97024017936/is-it-possible-to-be-me-and-accepted","slug":"is-it-possible-to-be-me-and-accepted","type":"text","date":"2014-09-09 02:30:26 GMT","timestamp":1410229826,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"KdAPy2Fd","tags":["ftm","trans","trigger","tw","depression","feelinglost"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/Zg5dVn1QN5GOG","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":0,"title":"Is it possible to be me and accepted?","body":"Hey. I’m a 29 year old trans guy. I realized I was something other than female a few years ago. And a few months ago I realized that I was FTM. I’ve been running from this thought for a long time. As much as I applaud others who have transitioned in life, I didn’t want it for me. I see how society at large is still unaccepting of trans people. I just want to live a normal boring life. As much as I want to further LGBT rights, I want to do this as an ally, not one of the letters. But I’ve finally accepted that I am in that acronym. I am a “T”. The thing I struggle with now is to let everyone else into the revelation or not. My choices seem to be; live as an unhappy woman accepted by people, or live as a trans man and face a life alone. Neither seems particularly great.\n\nI’ve had many people tell me to just be me. That I’m the only one I have to live with. If people can’t accept me than I don’t need them in my life. And many other such well meaning platitudes. I get the sentiment, but it doesn’t help me. I feel the most fear when it comes to my family. I’m sure you can imagine. I know my family will always love me and accept me. But I’m scared of them not accepting the real me. Seeing who I am on the inside. I worry it will cause a divide. I’m very close to both my parents and my brother. It would devastate me to lose that closeness.\n\nMy other concern is romantic in nature. I’m attracted to men. So, I’m a gay trans man. I’m also a virgin. Not the best combination. I’ve hated my body so much that I can’t imagine letting someone touch it. I can’t even find someone to love me now. How the hell am I going to do it when I have an even smaller subset of the population to work with? Gay men who are willing to date trans men. I know they’re out there. But there are far fewer than there are straight men.\n\nOr, I can just act like a straight woman and hope despair doesn’t take over my life. If there was a pill that would make me cis, I’d take it in an instant.\n\nThe point of this post is not to get sympathy. And I don’t want platitudes or “answers”. I’m just getting it out there. Maybe someone can relate. Or maybe someone can share their experience. I don’t know.","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"kissncryspain","id":97023938717,"post_url":"http://kissncryspain.tumblr.com/post/97023938717/140905-dia-instagram-update","slug":"140905-dia-instagram-update","type":"photo","date":"2014-09-09 02:29:31 GMT","timestamp":1410229771,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"lZphJFHd","tags":["Trans","Instagram","140905","Dia","KNC","Kiss&Cry","KissAndCry"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZYDcco1QN4z2T","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":0,"caption":"[140905] DIA Instagram Update\n\n해나언니 화이팅!!!!!! 우린 다 잘될꺼에요!!!!!\n\n[ENG] Haena unnie fighting!!!!!! Such A Girl","body":"You cant change who you are or who you’re going to be. Although a great handful of us wish to be others and don’t see our own light that shines off like we should. We tend to waste a huge portion of our lives envying others when we could be working to make ourselves better. Looking up to someone isn’t bad, just don’t copy their ways with intentions to make yourself exactly like them. A lot of the reason we like the things we do are because of people who we admire.\n\nI try to be myself but it’s not an easy task for anyone really. Society, a great deal of the time, knocks us down on our asses just for shits and giggles. The ideal look and standards set are ridiculous. I can’t even be open about the type of people I love without some type of discrimination. We say we are trying to change when really it’s getting worse.\n\nWhy am I not aloud to wear the clothes I want without being questioned?\n\nI do pretty often get stares and nasty comments for wearing the other genders clothing, no one told me it was against the law to look like a boy?\n\nYou would never believe how many times I’ve been asked about my hair. In fact my entire family has openly told me they think I’m suicidal just because of how short my hair is now. My mother won’t let me dye it colors I want to, scared the family will continue to think I want to kill myself. Comments like these are what is going to drive me to death. You have no idea how much better it would be, I could be a boy in the after life and no one would tell me it’s wrong.\n\nOf course it wasn’t always this way. I did in fact fit into society’s standards for a good portion of my life.\n\nOh, was it hell for me. The thing is though, I didn’t completely understand why it even was hell for me. I always blamed my weight and poor eating habits. For a short period of time I would starve myself and even look to self harm to help. It was bad enough where I needed to see a therapist and was prescribed depression pills, which in fact made me feel worse so I took myself off them.\n\nI can not explain to you how good it feels to consider myself as a boy even if no one else does. Everything for the first time has felt right. I can feel myself recovering pretty quickly. I can not control the dysphoria I get because of things I cant change like, periods, boobs, and not having a penis of manly build.\n\nYou can hurt me very easily and a lot. Not just because me as a person gets offended easily but also because referring to me as a girl or any girly part of me is extremely wrong. Why would you need to know my birth name? Because you’re curious? That’s a shit answer really and unless you’re the fucking president or FBI asking I will not tell you my birth name.\n\nWhy does it matter if I identify as a boy and still am attracted to males? Now I know half the world is homophobic but that does not in anyway mean I cant love who I want to.\n\nIf I want to be with a boy, I fucking will.\n\nIf I want to be with a girl, I fucking will.\n\nNothing you say can change how I am or who I like in anyway. You can, and probably will, hurt me as much as you please but I will never change. Why would I want to be a sad cutting depressed girl I WAS instead of the happy recovering boy I I am dfab and identify as female, but I'm extremely uncomfortable with my body, especially the particularly feminine areas and genitals. I wish to have a flat chest and a boyish body, to the point where it makes me miserable and uncomfortable with myself. I do wear binders and flattering clothes to straighten my shape. And I'm thin, so this is not a weight issue. Is this dysmorphia or dysphoria?","answer":"Well, when we use dysphoria, we mean in the sense of ‘gender dysphoria’, which is a symptom (or sometimes a synonym) of gender identity disorder. So if you’re cis, the correct word would be dysmorphia. However, you may want to re-think, as it doesn’t really sound like you’re cis, and there are non-binary genders that you could look into that may suit you more.","can_reply":false}]

23:40:00 GMT","timestamp":1410219600,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"H8FDmnWH","tags":["mtf","trans","hormones","honesty","invitation","learning"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZdshLn1QMGR7v","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":1,"title":"Progress?","body":"I have been seeing a therapist for a while now. First, it was a marriage and family therapist with no specific knowledge of transgender issues. She was very helpful and allowed me to lay my thoughts and feelings out and help organize and make sense of them. She didn’t do that much work but she sure helped me do some.\n\nNow I have begun to see a therapist that has far more intimate knowledge of the LGBTQ community and is very much involved in the local transgender activities. She has been very helpful. Guiding me and asking thought provoking questions of me but not guiding in the sense of “oh yeah! you need hormones and surgery and stuff”. She allows me to open up and she pokes me enough to help me evaluate me. She helps me find the tools to speak with my wife about these issues and where we should go. I am feeling better with her.\n\nAs of our chat today I will be setting an appointment to see a local doctor. He will be doing my blood panel and we will be discussing hormone treatments. This step may be the one that destroys my marriage. The step that begins the true transformation into womanhood. For me this is huge. Finally moving toward the goal. Being a woman in more physical form. \n\nI’m so very excited but now there is homework to do. I have been assigned, by my therapist, to go home and talk to my wife. Talk to her. Calmly with no yelling and wanton destruction of pedestal fans. To gently re-invite her to look at this journey that I am taking. To allow her to see what she can or will. To also re-invite her to see this therapist or one of her choosing. For me to help give her the tools to examine her love for me and how she may, or may not, accept my being transgender.\n\nIf she can take time to learn, even if she decides to move on she may do so with the knowledge of what’s happening and not just myth and superstition. Maybe she will take my invitation or perhaps she won’t. We have not had a really good productive talk for a long time. This will be a bit hard for me, to speak with her honestly and plainly without having a fit and acting like an idiot.\n\nI am also supposed to sit with her, if she’ll let me, and watch the documentary Trans. I have not yet seen it and I hope she’ll watch it with me. We can only wait and see.\n\nI’m still excited no matter what happens. I’ll keep you posted.\n\nHUGS for all of you.\n\nKatie","accepts_answers":true,"can_reply":false}]

From what I understand, there is one other step. Because they follow an informed consent model, there is an appointment with a hormone advocate and then the medical appointment to get the prescription, but both can be in the same day.\n\nIt’s kind of surreal. I’m not even sure I’m ready, but I figured I’d go do the preliminary stuff and decide afterward how I feel and when I want to do what.\n\nThings to do now:\n\n1. Decide how I want to document this next step in my journey. New tumblr? This tumblr? YouTube? I’ve got some desire to be anonymous, but you know, the internet has a way of making that difficult.\n\n2. Try to get my difficult schedule to be a bit more manageable so the stress of starting T doesn’t cause my life to explode.\n\nOther notes:\n\nI recently had some photos of me, my partner, and family on Facebook. Everyone commented how good we looked. I thought it was a little overboard, but my partner said it was because I looked genuinely happy and that that hasn’t come through in photos for a very long time.\n\nMy partner also said they thought my eyes have changed in the last month or two. Like I’m pregnant or something (PS, there’s no chance of that).\n\nIt does feel that way a bit to me. There’s an extra sparkle in my view of the world—like something extraordinary is about to happen, and I’m the only one who knows about community","ask","answered"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/Zrx0ut1QLqfnI","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":0,"asking_name":"Anonymous","asking_url":null,"question":"why do you hate cis people","answer":"I’m sorry, I don’t think I’ve ever once said that I “hate cis people.” As a matter of fact, almost all of my best friends are cis. It would make no sense for me to hate them being as I don’t hate anyone for who they are inside or out. I hate maybe a total of five people in this world and that is because of things that they have done to me personally or have put me and friends through. Whether or not someone is cis is not grounds enough for me to hate them, and it would be utterly pointless. Just like how it would be pointless for someone that is cis to hate me because I am trans*. See? There’s no logic in it. I basically love everyone, give or take those five people, and I want nothing more than for everyone to feel that they matter. \n\nSo I don’t hate cis people, never have and never will.","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"fairlion-jade","id":97002754079,"post_url":"http://fairlion-jade.tumblr.com/post/97002754079/i-cringe-whenever-i-see-people-with-penises-or","slug":"i-cringe-whenever-i-see-people-with-penises-or","type":"text","date":"2014-09-08 prompt on my D2L.\n\nHere’s the prompt and my response:\n\nPrompt:\n\nRiki Wilchins (transgender activitst and founder of GenderPAC) wrote in her piece entitled “A Continuous Nonverbal Communication,” that “Gender is like a lens through which we’ve not yet learned to see. Or, more accurately, like glasses worn from childhood, it’s like a lens through which we’ve always seen and can’t remember how the world looked before. And the lens is strictly bifocal. It strangely shows us only black and white in a Technicolor world.”\n\nDo you think Siebler would agree with this idea? What issues of gender politics are a play in the (attempted) cultural and social undestanding of transgender identity and media respresentation? Does an individual’s ability to consume and create content (and identity) via a digital medium help to mitgate the issues of gender politics? What examples of a mediated trans identity do we have? \n\nMy response:\n\nI wrote two posts on my personal blog while reading this piece, I had a very strong reaction to it, and was, honestly, offended that the first time I find transgender people discussed in an academic textbook it starts off talking about and framing the conversation around a white, cisgender, heterosexual man.\n\n—-\n\n\"Transgender characters such as Laverne Cox on ‘I Want to Work for Diddy’, Carmelita on ‘Dirty Sexy Money’, and Isis King on ‘America’s Top Model’ all fit the ‘chick with a dick, gay barbie’ stereotype of MTF transqueers.\" (136)\n\nTwo of the three people that Siebler is writing about here are transwomen. One I know for a fact is self-identified as a transwoman. Siebler, who just earlier was praising Tim Curry for his embracing of femininity (“If we did not want to be just like Curry *and* his character, we wanted to be his friend.”) Boldly attacks tranwomen for theirs, “She (Laverne Cox) is articulate, smart, and politically astute. But these dynamics of her politics and intellect never make it to the ‘I Want to Work for Diddy’ show where she plays a stereotypical “gay Barbie” with big hair, Valley Girl language and glamorous fashion.”\n\n—-\n\nSiebler does not write of trans people in a language that suggests that they are trans themselves. And yet, whether trans or not, they seem hyper-critical of the fact that transpeople go to great lengths to “pass” without giving any space to discussing the experiences that trans people have as living trans and navigating the world as trans that causes them to feel a need to move towards spaces of “passing” one way or the other.\n\nWith those posted, I can more directly address the prompt now.\n\nI very much believe that Siebler would agree with Wilchins. Siebler espouses how much they view Dr. Frank-N-Furter as the technicolor to an otherwise black and white world.\n\nWhat issues are at play? We have issues of representation - both quantifiably, but also qualitatively. What qualitatively qualifies as a transgender person in the media. Siebler gives the reader the impression that Timothy Curry and Ru Paul in drag are at the forefront of what it means to be transgender, while transwomen such as Laverne Cox and Candis Cayne are simply reinforcing gender stereotypes and acting out for the camera (see my quote from Siebler above). So there we have what qualifies as a stereotype and what qualifies as authentic gender expression at play. We seem to also have at play this cissexism and man-identified-centrism that plays out (thus why we see Curry raised up and praised, while Cox is vilified). This all seems to play into, or at least feed off/fuel the oppositional idea, that these women (Cox, Cayne) are not real women, and so when they enter women’s spaces, they are thusly violating women and their (women’s) spaces. This can be seen exemplified best in the fascination with genitalia, which I’ve already talked about extensively, and in the bathroom panic craze that is fuel by the media.\n\nI fully believe, and have it exemplified in my own life, that a person’s ability to consume and create content via a digital medium can help to mitigate the issues of gender politics. The popular blogging site Tumblr is where I finally found the language and community to be comfortable and out, at least to myself, as transgender, as a transwoman.\n\nBy ‘examples of a mediated trans identity’, do we mean, like in my case, that I mediated my gender identity (in part) online? Do we mean the way that trans people are prevalant in media (i.e. Laverne Cox, Buck Angel, Ryan Cassata, Fallon Fox, Janet Mock, Laura Jane Grace, etc.) or do we mean the overall ways in which trans identities are mediated (ie. by actual trans people, by heterosexual cisgender men, by heterosexual cisgender women, etc.)?","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"rimjets","id":96999469591,"post_url":"http://rimjets.tumblr.com/post/96999469591/hudsons-guide-myths-and-misconceptions-about","slug":"hudsons-guide-myths-and-misconceptions-about","type":"link","date":"2014-09-08 It doesn’t matter if you think non-binary genders exist or not, they do & will exist with or without your input. Your opinion is irrelevant to their existence.\n\nAlso, you don’t know what asexuality is. Asexuality is not a gender, it’s a sexuality (or a lack of, if you prefer). [{"blog_name":"llerret","id":96989659331,"post_url":"http://llerret.tumblr.com/post/96989659331/retday-eve","slug":"retday-eve","type":"photo","date":"2014-09-08 19:18:14 GMT","timestamp":1410203894,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"4GKuw7Pz","tags":["me","trans","transsexual","transgender","trans*","mtf","male to female","hrt","hormones","weave","versatile weave","natural weave","partial weave","sew in weave","sew in","blue black","hair","makeup","selfie"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/Zd4fTx1QL2C33","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":10,"caption":"Rétday Eve","image_permalink":"http://llerret.tumblr.com/image/96989659331","photos":[{"caption":"","alt_sizes":[{"width":708,"height":708,"url":"http://38.media.tumblr.com/3a8012c1454271d1d449fd05f3cf39f7/tumblr_nblkaeLy9i1qkrzsco1_1280.jpg"},{"width":500,"height":500,"url":"http://38.media.tumblr.com/3a8012c1454271d1d449fd05f3cf39f7/tumblr_nblkaeLy9i1qkrzsco1_500.jpg"},{"width":400,"height":400,"url":"http://38.media.tumblr.com/3a8012c1454271d1d449fd05f3cf39f7/tumblr_nblkaeLy9i1qkrzsco1_400.jpg"},{"width":250,"height":250,"url":"http://38.media.tumblr.com/3a8012c1454271d1d449fd05f3cf39f7/tumblr_nblkaeLy9i1qkrzsco1_250.jpg"},{"width":100,"height":100,"url":"http://33.media.tumblr.com/3a8012c1454271d1d449fd05f3cf39f7/tumblr_nblkaeLy9i1qkrzsco1_100.jpg"},{"width":75,"height":75,"url":"http://38.media.tumblr.com/3a8012c1454271d1d449fd05f3cf39f7/tumblr_nblkaeLy9i1qkrzsco1_75sq.jpg"}],"original_size":{"width":708,"height":708,"url":"http://38.media.tumblr.com/3a8012c1454271d1d449fd05f3cf39f7/tumblr_nblkaeLy9i1qkrzsco1_1280.jpg"}}],"can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"incorrectusage","id":96989186222,"post_url":"http://incorrectusage.tumblr.com/post/96989186222/could-you-explain-what-a-or-bigender-is-if-gender-is","slug":"could-you-explain-what-a-or-bigender-is-if-gender-is","type":"answer","date":"2014-09-08 19:11:39 GMT","timestamp":1410203499,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"JeepYwV2","tags":["trans","definitions","Anonymous","rezi gets asks"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZYHEZq1QL0OYk","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":1,"asking_name":"Anonymous","asking_url":null,"question":"Could you explain what a- or bigender is? If gender is the set of genitals you're the most comfortable with, then a/bigender should mean that you want neither/both of them, shouldn't it? But AFAIK, no one gets their genitals removed without a substitute, or the \"missing\" set together with the one they already have. If it's more like a Idon'tgiveafuck-gender, then why make a big deal out of it by yelling at people who got your pronouns wrong? I just don't understand it.","answer":"To the best of my knowledge:\n\nAgender- Needing the sex characteristics of neither sex in order to lessen dysphoria. This is a sucky situation to be in, because without massive nullification surgery (which is usually illegal), it’s nearly-impossible. Of course other dysphoria-reducing methods can be employed, hormones, pronoun changes, surgeries to remove obvious secondary sex characteristics, etc. \n\nBigender part one- Someone who fluctuates between two genders. Some believe this to be a case of mistaken normal symptoms as something else. Since dysphoria fluctuates in every trans person, binary or no, it might be possible bigender people are binary but have very strong fluctuations. My thought is that it is most likely that, but it could also (maybe) be a rapid-cycle version of part two.\n\nBigender part two- There is a known phenomena where people will have sex dysphoria very strongly for years, and then shift back to having none (being non-dysphoric about their birth sex) for years. (Which could become a case of having dysphoria towards the sex they transitioned to.) Then they shift back after years, etc. It’s insanely, extremely rare and controversial (maybe they were never dysphoric and transitioned and acquired actual dysphoria.)\n\nPeople who don’t give a fuck about their gender- This is a result of cis privilege. Not having think about your gender constantly is a privilege we are in possession of. Trans people have to be aware of their gender constantly- sometimes for safety, sometimes because of dysphoria, sometimes because of the millions of things it takes to transition. Like how white people don’t have to think about race, cis people don’t have to think about gender. So it’s upsetting (and rude!) to call someone a wrong pronoun, even if they don’t give too many fucks. 17:52:22 GMT","timestamp":1410198742,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"JZ6aq7aP","tags":["transgender","trans","trans healthcare","gender identity clinic","trans uk","northern ireland"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZwIxis1QKj3gN","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":24,"text":"Gender Identity Clinics have a reputation. In times gone by (and still to this date, at some clinics), healthcare providers have required trans people to navigate ridiculous and unreasonable obstacles before being granted access to treatment. \n\nRequiring stereotypical gender presentation, being “out” to everyone prior to treatment, “Real Life Experience” (the requirement to change gender presentation prior to treatment, a practice that still exists and puts patients in danger), insistence upon gender-nonconforming career changes, unhelpful mental healthcare and the rejection of patients seen to be “not trans enough” are just a few of the historical problems with GICs. \n\nIn the past, clinics were places of genuine discrimination based upon gender presentation, and stereotypes and unreasonable gatekeeping were rife. It is largely improved today, but some GICs still participate in a toned-down version of these practices.","source":"I’m writing a blog post called “Trans healthcare: We need to talk about the grey areas”, because we need to talk about the grey areas of trans healthcare.\n\nThese are the introductory paragraphs.","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"imsorrycameron","id":96984093020,"post_url":"http://imsorrycameron.tumblr.com/post/96984093020/my-birthday-is-coming-up-on-the-11th-which-is","slug":"my-birthday-is-coming-up-on-the-11th-which-is","type":"photo","date":"2014-09-08 17:51:58 GMT","timestamp":1410198718,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"sk67KGnW","tags":["forcameron","ftm","trans","queer","gay","glbt","lgbt","snakebites"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZlGw-x1QKiz5S","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":2,"caption":"My birthday is coming up on the 11th, which is Thursday! [{"blog_name":"tarararajean","id":96983713625,"post_url":"http://tarararajean.tumblr.com/post/96983713625/i-feel-like-i-ought-to-come-with-a-disclaimer-that","slug":"i-feel-like-i-ought-to-come-with-a-disclaimer-that","type":"text","date":"2014-09-08 17:45:46 GMT","timestamp":1410198346,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"yGI75pGR","tags":["trans","transgender","lgbt","lgbtq","mogi","gsm","queer","mtf","transition","psa","disclaimer","grs","srs","genitals","surgery","upset","i want ice cream"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZrlSrt1QKhWTP","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":10,"title":"","body":"I feel like I ought to come with a disclaimer that says\n\n\"this girl has a penis.\n\nIf you ask this girl whether or not she has a penis, she may become upset\n\nThis is not her fault\n\nAsking about someone’s genitals is rude\n\nAnd punishable by law\n\nMinimum fine, ice cream\n\nUp to and including Genital Reconstruction Surgery (GRS) (for both her and you) ($30,000)”\n\nThis has been a psa","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"aidenparkerstransition","id":96983374074,"post_url":"http://aidenparkerstransition.tumblr.com/post/96983374074/tried-to-get-in-touch-with-the-therapist-in-our","slug":"tried-to-get-in-touch-with-the-therapist-in-our","type":"text","date":"2014-09-08 17:40:12 GMT","timestamp":1410198012,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"3ZDxC9Wb","tags":["ftm","transgender","female to male","trans","trans*","transman","HRT","t","Testosterone","endo","wpath"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/Z-49cm1QKgDZw","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":0,"title":"","body":"Tried to get in touch with the therapist in our town again that specializes with transgender patients. The info here is so botchy :/","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"emilyskelling","id":96982989902,"post_url":"http://emilyskelling.tumblr.com/post/96982989902/dear-anyone-if-you-ever-pass-judgement-on-a","slug":"dear-anyone-if-you-ever-pass-judgement-on-a","type":"text","date":"2014-09-08 17:33:52 GMT","timestamp":1410197632,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"x8O1wzKS","tags":["lgbtq","equality","trans","true equality","cis","no to racism","nonbinary","bigotry","feminism"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZxMCIq1QKelnE","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":0,"title":"","body":"Dear ANYONE,\n\nIf you ever pass judgement on a group of people (the LGBTQ community, other races, other sexes or genders, other religions or beliefs etc) as a whole, as in EVERYBODY within that group is a (insert insult here). Then you are a fucking idiot. It is in fact that simple. To do that is the height of ignorance and stupidity. If you were to judge an individual on their own behavior (being rude or cruel, kind or caring, accepting and progressive, bigoted or racist) then you are saying “Hey person, I don’t/do like what you’re doing”. You cannot EVER apply what SOME people in a group do to the WHOLE GROUP. You cannot hate an entire race because a person of that race treated you badly. You cannot hate an enter gender because someone of that gender treated you badly. You cannot hate an entire religion, faith or belief because someone treated you badly. \n\nAs a trans person, I know how it feels to not quite fit in with the “norm” (whatever the fuck that even is), but I have never decided that an entire group is against me. Because I’m not fucking stupid. I take the problems that are faced by trans people as they come. If (hypothetically speaking and because this is what Tumblr seems to get its panties in a knot about the most) a white/cis/male gave me shit, I would be hating on that person, not the entirety of white/cis/males. If you hate on an entire group because of your treatment at the hands of one asshole belonging to that group, guess what, you are the fucking problem, not the group. There are, however, some problems faced by the trans community that are there because of social (again, what even) “norms” like public restrooms and gender specific areas etc. But you still cannot label everyone you meet that is cis as ‘scum’ because of this.\n\nHating a whole group because of your shitty treatment at the hands of a few is going to have the exact opposite effect if you want their support or acceptance. Rather than waging war on groups of people and generalizing the shit out of them, maybe you should focus on waging war on the assholes who give the groups a bad name.\n\nI cannot believe how many people on this site are so pathetic they can’t want to be offended and try to start shit. What boring, sad and unfulfilled lives you lead. To hate a group or to generalized a group so completely is exactly what you should be fighting against, not doing yourselves. In your fight against oppression, you have become the oppressors.\n\nAnd as for the privilege argument, to hate someone based on what they were born with is just flat out discrimination. Who the fuck do you think you are to complain that someone is oppressing you just by being born a certain race or gender/sex. You shout for equality, but you don’t even know the meaning of the word. You don’t want to be equal to the ‘privileged scum’ you want to be the privileged scum. You want to reign supreme above the people you hate. You are a fucking idiot. \n\nAnd I would also like to point out that every minute of everyday you are using something that was created by a person from a group you hate. For example all the cis hate on Tumblr, people saying that cis people should all die, BY POSTING ON A SITE CREATED BY A CIS PERSON. \n\nBasically when you discover what equality really means and if you decide that that is what you actually want, then we can talk. An asshole is an asshole regardless or race, sex, gender or religion. If you are not an asshole we should get along 17:23:15 GMT","timestamp":1410196995,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"naQlBQEo","tags":["Anonymous","trans","transgender","bisexual","social justice","panesexual","lgbtqia+","mogai","transphobia","cissexism"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZHQdjr1QKcIs0","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":19,"asking_name":"Anonymous","asking_url":null,"question":"I identify as pan. I thought being bi meant you were attracted to those who identify as male or female (I also include trans people in this definition of bisexuality) ? Have I got this wrong? A couple of friends get offended when I mention we should support each other rather then moan because  we both face the same lack of representation, as it suggests we are the same when obviously I'm completely happy to engage in a relationship with cis trans or non binaries lovelies, & they don't","answer":"Nah, bisexual means that you’re attracted to two or more (or same/other) genders, but not necessarily all genders. So for example you might be attracted to non-binary people and women, and you would be bisexual. Pansexual, in comparison, means that you’re attracted to all genders. So there is a difference, albeit a fairly subtle one, and there’s a fair bit of crossover.\n\nThe thing is, a lot of people do use bisexual in a cissexist way (i.e. just male/female), often cutting out non-binary people (or even not recognising binary trans people), but using it that way is transphobic & cissexist.","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"rachel-rebellion","id":96981749210,"post_url":"http://rachel-rebellion.tumblr.com/post/96981749210/so-in-the-class-that-i-ta-for-there-is-a-girl-who","slug":"so-in-the-class-that-i-ta-for-there-is-a-girl-who","type":"text","date":"2014-09-08 17:13:14 GMT","timestamp":1410196394,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"z2ODQMOK","tags":["trans","bullying","students","school","thank you","we all have something that can be made fun of"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZgR2tt1QKa0tQ","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":2,"title":"","body":"So in the class that I TA for there is a girl who is trans. He identifies himself as a male and dresses as such and everything. He is always really quiet in class and today in class when he spoke with a girl’s voice everyone started laughing at him and making jokes… What the fuck is wrong with people? Now everyone is calling him a girl and saying her and she rather than him and he as they were last week. Someone just called him a faggot and a pussy and I’m so done with students at this school. (My teacher was not in the classroom at the time so he couldn’t say anything.) I stood up and basically told everyone to shut the fuck up because they all have something about them that could he made fun of. Some guy claimed he didn’t and I said, “How about this is your 5th year of highschool and you’re in the lowest possible math class.” That shut him up as did the rest of the class and when I looked over at the guy who everyone was making fun of, he just mouthed the words, “Thank You” and I can just tell already that I’m going to get a lot of shit for this, but it will be so worth [{"blog_name":"likenothingeverhappened","id":96974546770,"post_url":"http://likenothingeverhappened.tumblr.com/post/96974546770/so-i-stress-myself-out-by-researching","slug":"so-i-stress-myself-out-by-researching","type":"text","date":"2014-09-08 15:05:00 GMT","timestamp":1410188700,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"L0YwVdeE","tags":["ftm","trans","detransition","female to male","dysphoria","thinking","thoughts","emotional","hormonal","transgender","transitioning","ftm transgender","androgel","6 months","growth","becoming me","me"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZExENv1QK8YTI","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":2,"title":"","body":"So I stress myself out by researching “detransitioning” and transmen who have decided to stop the FTM process and live as women. I’m already so confused on what I want, who I am and what I stand for but now with this.\n\nDo I just believe everything I read? Why do I automatically believe thats me, my calling? Going from woman to man to woman? No, I couldn’t. That doesn’t seem right. I like this, I’m happy this way. I’m happy even being a freak but living a man’s life, the life for me, has truly given me reason to keep living. I no longer want to end my life if it’s lived the way I truly feel inside. \n\nSelf doubt will always kill me. I hate hormones and pronouns and having to explain it everyday. I hate being misgendered and called a woman. I hate my high voice and I repel anything that has to do with my past identification. I don’t mind feminine things, but I’m pretty positive this is the happiest, and hardest, path for me. credits.","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"ketamine-dream","id":96973135044,"post_url":"http://ketamine-dream.tumblr.com/post/96973135044/if-ur-cis-why-the-fuck-do-you-need-to-tell-me-ur","slug":"if-ur-cis-why-the-fuck-do-you-need-to-tell-me-ur","type":"text","date":"2014-09-08 things","ftm","me"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/Zmcp8x1QK39p4","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":2,"title":"","body":"If ur cis why the fuck do you need to tell me ur preferred pronouns? Like shit, is my life that much of a joke/game to you? I struggle with this shit everyday. Don’t pretend you fucking know how it feels. Miss me with this shit.","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"transitional-monster","id":96972788501,"post_url":"http://transitional-monster.tumblr.com/post/96972788501/the-road-here-is-jumbled","slug":"the-road-here-is-jumbled","type":"text","date":"2014-09-08 14:32:00 GMT","timestamp":1410186720,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"LtRHC12W","tags":["journal","transition","trans","ftm"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/ZOuwXm1QK1rCL","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":0,"title":"The Road Here is Jumbled","body":"Gender identity is always something I kind of avoided. I wasn’t like other guys who found out what it is to be trans and had their identity click on like a light. I’ve known about the trans community for a while now. I’ve supported friends as they questioned their own identities and came out. I’ve even joined friends at trans support group meetings. All the while I avoided my own gender issues. It’s part of my personality; I avoid negative emotions like the plague (if you know anything about personality typing, I’m an Enneagram 7w6).\n\nImagine my surprise when I’m watching a transition video with Husband and feel a sharp pang of jealousy. It caught me off guard, and to be honest it scared me. I know it’s not an easy road, and I don’t take the decision to explore it lightly.\n\nLike I said, I don’t fall into the group of people who go “Oh, trans is a thing? Now I know what I am!” but that’s not to say I ever really accepted my identity as female. In fact I’ve always whole-heartedly, almost violently rejected it. Even at a young age I was offended if people suggested I was a girl. No, I don’t want princess face paint, I want to be a knight. Halloween was a yearly battle with my mom, who wanted my costumes to be somewhat recognizable as female. I hated dresses and skirts and bows, was furious when people bought me Barbies, hated my name for being too overtly feminine, and chopped all my hair off the moment I was allowed. Really the only thing I didn’t outright reject were pronouns.\n\nI went so far as to start joking about being a “man’s man.” I always felt like I needed to prove myself. Kind of like the quintessential “becoming a man” trial, only it was every opportunity to be masculine of every day. I never felt like I was taken seriously.\n\nFor a long time, though, I simply considered myself a tomboy. A really boyish tomboy. When I did scratch the surface of gender identity, I was under this misconception that because I didn’t have very strong dysphoria (eh, boobs, eh, vagina), that I wasn’t trans enough to really be trans. That maybe it wasn’t being female that I rejected, just the social idea of being feminine. After all, I’ve read stories of kids from very young ages knowing they were trans. If they just knew shouldn’t I just know?\n\nBut that’s not how it works for everyone. Maybe that’s not how it works for It’s usually from people who are checking me out at a store or swiping my card in the cafeteria or whatever. It’s my voice that gives me away, which is a bummer, but I don’t expect to pass and so, while I definitely don’t like being called “ma’am” or “she” or “miss”, I understand why it happens and I let it go. I can’t wait til someone calls me “sir”, though, and doesn’t “correct” themself when I open my mouth.","can_reply":false},{"blog_name":"jewishandmore","id":96970389291,"post_url":"http://jewishandmore.tumblr.com/post/96970389291/a-morning-blessing-at-the-transfaith-conference","slug":"a-morning-blessing-at-the-transfaith-conference","type":"text","date":"2014-09-08 13:43:53 GMT","timestamp":1410183833,"state":"published","format":"html","reblog_key":"2kj8aVa3","tags":["LGBT","Trans","Transfaith","Morning Blessings","Gratitude","Spirituality","Soul","Body","Spirit"],"short_url":"http://tmblr.co/Z5sRBy1QJuhSh","followed":false,"highlighted":[],"liked":false,"note_count":0,"title":"A morning blessing at the Transfaith Conference","body":"[I delivered this on Friday, August 29 with the wonderful people of the Transfaith Conference here in Charlotte, NC]\n\nאֱלֹהַי, נְשָׁמָה שֶׁנָּתַתָּ בִּי טְהוֹרָה הִיא\n\nMy God, the soul you have given me is pure.\n\nAs we look out upon this day, among these beautiful people around us, let us acknowledge the shining purity and beauty of the spirits we find around us this morning.\n\nLet us revel in the light that we bring to each other and share with one another.\n\nIn Jewish traditions we begin our mornings in gratitude - first for our bodies, may they work well enough so that we can offer praise and thanks. Then we notice that our spirits still reside within us, and that that essence is pure, and we celebrate the return of our souls into our bodies after that absent time during our slumbers.\n\nEach morning we look out upon the world and offer up gratitude because a day that begins with gratitude is a better day. A day that we transform with words of thanks in turn transforms us into grateful people.\n\nI am so grateful to be among all of you today. \n\nSo I offer you another blessing from the opening prayers of a Jewish morning service:\n\nבָּרוּךְ אַתָּה יְיָ אֱלֹהֵינוּ מֶלֶךְ הָעוֹלָם, שֶׁעָשַׂנִי בְּצֶלֶם אֱלֹהִים\n\nPraised are You, the Infinite source of a miraculous creation, who made me, and all of us, in the divine image.\n\nEach and every one of us here today reflects another gorgeous facet of the image of the divine. To be in the image of the infinite is to be infinitely varied. \n\nLet us begin our day in praise of the purity of our inner spirits, and in awe of the beautiful variety of our outward appearances.\n\nLet our time together be filled with soulful beauty, and pure diversity, and let us say:
